Conversation: Get up as early as six o'clock only to be jammed at every crossroad and still late for work . What a life ! I've had enough of it . Cool down , man . Everyone is fed up with the rush-hour traffic . But life isn't really all that . You should take the initiative and make some changes first . What should I do then ? I recommend you ride a bike instead of commuting by bus . It may offer you many benefits . First , it's good for your health . I'm afraid it's not necessary for me to further elaborate . While lots of people spend time like an hour each morning exercising , a bike ride to work not only builds you up , but also makes full use of time . You might as well sleep out for a longer hour . I know cycling is always a more favorable choice than a bus . After all , it's a sport . But do you think it a pleasant experience to take in the dirty , polled air on the road ? Well , such things are just unavoidable in a great metropolis like Beijing . I think a still more desirable benefit is psychological . Bicycling home after work can help release your stress . Life in the offices is miserable . You just sit there in a daze , gazing at the monitor and dealing with files and documents . Why don't you give a full play to your energy after work ? Enjoy the speed on the road . Just think , you are flashing past the poles with your own energy . How great !
Summaries: The speaker is frustrated with their daily commute, stuck in rush-hour traffic. They suggest taking initiative and making changes to alleviate the stress. The recommended change is to bike to work instead of taking the bus. This has multiple benefits: it's good for physical health, uses time efficiently (sleeping in an extra hour), and releases psychological stress by allowing a sense of freedom and energy release after work.

Conversation: I'm going to the park to play baseball with the guys . But you promised to play chess with me this afternoon . Yeah , but that was before the guys ask me to join the team . So what ? Conversation: What stresses you out the most ? Probably my parents . How so ? Well , during school , they wanted good grades . Then after I got a job , they wanted me to get a better job . Let's go .

The speaker shares that they've learned to cope with stress through socializing with friends and drinking, but acknowledges it's only temporary and the stress always returns.

Conversation: Let's have seafood tonight and then go see the new movie at Mall Cinema.Betsy told me it's a beautiful love story and I shouldn't miss it . Conversation: How's your new job going ? Really well , thanks . How are you finding your new boss ? She's not bad . She's a bit bossy , but I'm sure I'll get used to her . The work environment is friendly, with easy-going co-workers from different departments who get along well due to teamwork. The individual likes working in teams and finds it helps understand tasks from different perspectives, preferring team collaboration over independent work.

Conversation: ... And now , let ’ s go to Kenny Williams for today ’ s weather forecast . Thank you Bill , and good morning Salt Lake City ! What ’ s the weather looking like today , Kenny ? We will have more later on today on the six o ’ clock news . That ’ s the weather forecast for this morning .
Summaries: The weather forecast for Salt Lake City and Utah is mixed. Today, Northern Utah has heavy cloud cover with scattered showers and a high of 45°F, while Southern Utah expects clear skies but cold temperatures (30°F). Tomorrow, Northern Utah will have isolated downpours in the morning, with rain turning to sleet in the evening, while Southern Utah will see cloudy skies with a chance of showers and partly cloudy conditions later in the day.

Conversation: I am having a hard time at my job . What's wrong , Julia ? My colleagues quickly get promotions , while I always get sidelined . I don't know what to do anymore . Tell that to my boss . Do you know Abraham Lincoln ? Yes . He grew up poor in Kentucky and barely had a year of schooling , but he went on to become the President of United States . He was also assassinated because of his views . He is known as American's greatest president . Do you know why ? Because he fought against slavery and secession at a time in history where others were too afraid to do anything . He succeeded because of his ambition and generous spirit . Well , if he can become president , then I can at least get a promotion . That's the spirit . Never give up on your dream .
Summaries: The speaker is struggling with feelings of being overlooked for promotions at their job, despite willing to work hard. They've been making mistakes and getting criticized by their boss. The speaker is feeling frustrated and unsure what to do next. They're reminded that even Abraham Lincoln, who grew up poor and became President of the US, faced challenges but didn't give up. The speaker takes heart from Lincoln's story, deciding to never give up on their own dreams and ambitions.

Conversation: What do you think are the main causes of war today ? I ’ d say the main reason is poverty . Countries and their people get frustrated because they have so little . If their neighbors have some resources , they try to steal them by military force . It seems that a lot of wars nowadays are really civil wars . People from different ethnic groups in the same country sometimes fight for power in that country . Several of those civil wars have been going on for years and years . It seems they will never end . How do you think they could be ended ? I don ’ t think that there is any easy way . The united nations could send peacekeepers into the country . At least then the warring parties could be forced to negotiate . The thing is to find the real problem form the war and solve that . So , if the cause is poverty , there should be a program to make the country richer . If the problem is resources , share them . It sounds easy when you say it like that . In reality , it ’ s harder to make peace between countries . Yes . It is . One way to stop countries fighting is to cut off their financial support . Wars are very expensive . The problem is that many poor people might suffer .
Summaries: The main causes of war today are poverty and ethnic power struggles. Civil wars often involve neighbors trying to steal resources or gain power over each other. Ending these conflicts requires identifying the root cause and addressing it through programs like economic development or resource sharing. The United Nations could send peacekeepers to facilitate negotiations. Another approach is to cut off financial support, but this would come at a risk of harming poor people.

Conversation: Did you hear ? The state is thinking of legalizing gambling in our city ! Soon we are gonna have amazing hotels and casinos here which will be good for our business ! Are you serious ? How does it exploit people ? Well , to begin with , Gambling is addictive , ruins marriages , destroys families and bankrupts communities . Once you are addicted it is very difficult to stop . People have lost their houses , cars and been left out on the street after becoming addicted . Secondly , it exploits because men become addicted to gambling most often because of the action and risk . Women gamble to escape , and senior citizens will start gambling for the social interaction . Underage gamblers often start gambling on sports with friends and then illegal bookies . Geez ! Now that I think about it , maybe legalizing gambling isn ’ t such a good idea ! Although , I have been to Las Vegas , and I didn ’ t become addicted or anything like that . You cannot predict who will become addicted to gambling . Now excuse me , I have a protest rally to organize !
Summaries: The state is considering legalizing gambling in their city, which could bring in new business and hotels. They highlight how addiction can ruin marriages, destroy families, and bankrupt communities, as well as exploit different demographics such as men seeking thrills, women trying to escape, and senior citizens looking for social interaction. The opponent acknowledges that even they themselves did not become addicted after visiting Las Vegas, but emphasizes the unpredictability of gambling addiction and plans to organize a protest rally against legalizing it in their city.

Someone suggests that the new manager's dress code (dark suit, white shirt, tie) might have played a role in his selection, implying that women may need to conform to different norms to be considered for promotion.

Conversation: It's a sunny day , isn't it ? Yes , it is . I'm Jennifer . Nice to meet you . My name is David . Nice to meet you , too . Are you American ? No , I'm a Britisher . Where do you come from ? I come from America . Are you a freshman ? Yes . What about you ? Me , too . Great . Maybe we can study and play games together . I think we can be good friends . Yeah . Anytime .
Summaries: Two students, Jennifer (American) and David (British), meet on a sunny day. They introduce themselves, discover they're both freshmen, and express interest in studying and playing games together. They part ways with a positive sentiment about potentially becoming good friends.

Conversation: You keep bowling spares but no strike . I don't know why , but I think there's something wrong with my hands . I couldn't seem to be able to control it on the first ball . I don't think it was the problem with your hands , you did several excellent spares . You have no problem with your hands . Then why couldn't I get strike on the first ball ? The problem is you are too nervous . You want to have a strike so much , so you deliver the ball too hard . And when it comes to the I second roll , there's no pressure . That's why you could bowl all those spares . Really ? I will try again .
Summaries: The speaker is having trouble bowling strikes and believes their hands are the issue, but they're actually just too nervous and delivering the ball too hard. The lack of pressure on the second roll allows them to bowl spares successfully, but they need to relax and adjust their technique for a strike.

Conversation: Nice to see you , Patrick . Bob ! I hear your team won the match . Yeah . All of us tried our best . Congratulations ! Thanks .
Summaries: Patrick and two others, likely friends or acquaintances. The two unknown individuals' team has won a match, and they express gratitude for the congratulations received from Patrick.

Conversation: Are you free on the thirteenth in the afternoon ? No I'm afraid not . I'm meeting Ruth then . How about the fourteenth in the morning ? I'm sorry . I'm attending a meeting at the Hilton then . What about the next day ? No . I'm busy then too . I'm meeting Dorothy Heath at North Bridge Road . Are you free on Thursday afternoon ? Yes , I think I am . Let's meet for lunch at mouth restaurant . Good idea ! Is two o'clock okay ? That's fine . See you there !
Summaries: The person is unavailable to meet on the 13th, 14th, or next day due to prior commitments with Ruth, a meeting at the Hilton, and a meeting with Dorothy Heath. They are free on Thursday afternoon and agree to meet for lunch at MOUTH restaurant at 2 pm.

Conversation: Did you enjoy the movie ? Oh , it's really a drag . Sorry to hear that . I think it's even better than On the Golden pond . Hell with it ! Nobody will give it an Academy award !
Summaries: The person didn't enjoy the movie, finding it disappointing. They compare it unfavorably to "On Golden Pond", but don't expect it to receive critical acclaim or win an Academy Award anyway.

Conversation: Hi Jackie . You don't look too well . What's going on ? It's nothing . I'm just a little stressed out . Why ? What's stressing you out ? School . Since I was working part time , I had a difficult time keeping up with class . Now that we have exams coming up , I'm totally freaking out . The best thing to do is study as much as you can . I'm sure you'll do alright . I hope so . I guess I won't be sleeping for the next 3 days . That's what it'll take . I have to study for an exam too . Why don't we study together . We can encourage each other . That will be great .
Summaries: Jackie confides in someone that she's feeling stressed due to school pressures, specifically exams coming up. She's been working part-time and struggling to keep up with classwork. The person offers words of encouragement, suggesting they study together to help each other relax and prepare for their exams.

Conversation: The new webpage design is much more effective than before . I feel confident it will rope in a lot more business because of its user-friendly format . Why do you think the new page is so much better than the old page ? I thought the old page wasn't half bad ... The old page was okay , alright , but there wasn't a big influence in our sales volume , because the site wasn't developed with an eye towards the marketing aspect . Now it's different . We got our marketing department team in on the action , and the results are smashing ... What changes were made from the old page to the new page ? First , the visitors to the site are encouraged to give their contact information . They can sign up for a free monthly drawing . Once we've got their info , it goes into a database for future marketing mailers and advertising targeting . Also , there are clear links to descriptions of our products and services , so as to give confidence to new customers . We also added a specific area for on-line customer service ... So far we've gotten a ton of positive feedback ... Great !
Summaries: The new webpage design is considered more effective than the old one, expected to attract more business due to its user-friendly format. The improvements were made with input from the marketing department, resulting in increased sales volume. Changes include a sign-up form for a free monthly drawing, clear product/service descriptions, and an online customer service area. Feedback has been overwhelmingly positive.

Conversation: Did you know that drinking beer helps you sing better ? Are you sure ? How do you know ? Well , usually people think I'm a terrible singer , but after we all have a few beers , they say I sound a lot better ! Well , I heard that if you drink enough beer , you can speak foreign languages better ...
Summaries: The speaker shares a personal experience where they found that drinking beer improves their singing abilities, as others perceived them to be a terrible singer until after having a few beers. They also mention hearing that consuming large amounts of beer can enhance one's ability to speak foreign languages. The conversation implies that the speaker has observed these effects firsthand and is sharing their anecdotal evidence with others.

Conversation: Pardon me . Could you please pass me the tissue ? Sure , here you are . Thanks , I didn't expect the dish to be so spicy . Are you ok ? Yeah , I think the food is alright , it's not too spicy though it's a little salty for me . But you are Chinese , you should have known better . Well , not every Chinese can handle spicy food in the way people from Sichuan and Guizhou provinces can . Back where I come from , people don't eat a lot of papers and chilies . Oh , I see how this food can be really hard for you . I can sympathize with that . I stayed in Sichuan for a year . The food was difficult at the beginning . Every dish was so spicy . After a while though , I got used to the taste , and now I won't consider anything a real dish if it isn't spicy . Yeah , you can increase you tolerance for spicy food , but so far , I haven't had the need or the opportunity . Every time I try spicy food , it is a total disaster for my nose and eyes . I completely understand . I didn't intend on liking spicy food at first either , but when you have no other choices , you've got to adapt . Yeah , I guess that's a typical example of ' when in Rome , do as the Romans do . ' Exactly .
Summaries: The speaker asks for a tissue because they find the food too spicy. The person helping them, who is Chinese, suggests that they should be able to handle spicy food being from China. However, the speaker explains that not every Chinese can handle extremely spicy food like those from Sichuan and Guizhou provinces. They share their personal experience of adapting to spicy food after staying in Sichuan for a year, but another person reveals that they are still sensitive to spicy food and have never developed tolerance.

Conversation: Tom , Christmas Day is coming . Merry Christmas to you . Thank you . And a merry Christmas to you !
Summaries: The conversation starts with Tom mentioning Christmas Day is approaching, followed by wishing the other person a "Merry Christmas". The response acknowledges the gratitude and reciprocates the wish.

Conversation: Could you lend your bike to me for several days ? How long would you like to keep it ? Till the end of the week . Yes , that'd be all right .
Summaries: A request was made to borrow someone's bike for several days. The borrower agreed, but wanted to know how long they could keep the bike. The owner allowed it until the end of the week.

Conversation: Don't you feel a little strange taking the place of your old boss after he was demoted ? Yes , at first I felt very awkward . After Bill was demoted and then resigned , it was kind of like somebody died ! I mean the atmosphere in the office was like a funeral parlor or something . And then I was afraid people would look at me as a traitor for filling in his spot when the management asked me to ... Did they mutiny ? Thankful , no . I guess everyone understands the opportunity I had to step into a leadership role is so great for my career . I'm really moving up the ladder now that I'm considered a supervisor . After a couple weeks , it was like nothing happened . It is a really good chance for you to get more exposure at work . supervisors get to take the credit for all the hard work of the people under them . Yeah , and they also take the blame , that's what happened to my old boss ...
Summaries: After Bill was demoted and resigned, his replacement felt awkward taking over as supervisor. Initially, the office atmosphere was somber, like a funeral. However, with time, people came to understand the opportunity it presented for the new supervisor's career growth. The role allows for increased exposure, credit for team accomplishments, and accountability for mistakes (like what happened to Bill).

Conversation: How about a game of tennis ? Okay . Loser has to take out the trash for a month . It's a deal . See you in the court .
Summaries: the loser will take out the trash for a month. They confirm the arrangement and make plans to meet on the court.

Conversation: Are you feeling better today , Bill ? Well , it's hard to say . I cough a lot in the evening . You'd better give up smoking . It's bad for your health . You're right , but you know , it's hard to give up an old habit . But you should make up your mind first . You know , I often have to work till late at night . I need something to keep me awake . Why don't you go to bed and get up early ? You'll have the same time for work . Thank you for your advice ! I'll try it .
Summaries: Bill's friend advises him to quit smoking due to health concerns. Bill acknowledges it's hard to give up an old habit, but agrees to consider quitting. The friend also suggests that Bill should prioritize getting enough sleep and establishing a consistent schedule to balance work and personal life.

Conversation: Hi , John , how was your vacation ? Awesome , we went to Australia and New Zealand . That must have been wonderful . Do anything interesting ? Well , we went bungee jumping when we were in Australia . Wow ! Isn ’ t that dangerous ? A little , but the rush was worth it . Tell me about it . We jumped off a bridge and fell 500 feet before the bungee cord caught us . 500 feet ! I would never be able to do that . Yeah , It was scary , but exhilarating .
Summaries: John took an awesome vacation to Australia and New Zealand with his partner. They did some thrilling activities, including bungee jumping off a bridge in Australia. Although it was a bit dangerous, John described it as a rush worth taking. He jumped 500 feet before being caught by the bungee cord, which left him feeling exhilarated despite initial fears.

Conversation: What did her boss say to you ? He asked me to beef up in the work . Yeah . You look so unhappy recently . What ’ s the matter . Nothing , thanks . I am just not in the mood these days .
Summaries: The speaker's boss told them to increase their workload, and they're feeling unhappy and unmotivated as a result. When someone asks what's wrong, they brush it off, saying "nothing" and that they're just not in the right mood.

Conversation: Hi , Tina , it's Joe . Hi , Joe . What's the weather like there today ? It's really cold . It snowed all day and the school closed early . What's the temperature ? It's 20 degrees below zero now . It was even colder this morning . Have you heard what the weather is going to be like tomorrow ? I was watching the news a little earlier . They said it's probably going to snow tomorrow . I really don't like the winter . I wish it were summer . Me too . How's the weather where you are ? It's not too bad , but it's pretty cold here too . I heard it's going to be a little warmer tomorrow .
Summaries: Joe and Tina discussed the weather, with Joe reporting extremely cold temperatures (20 degrees below zero) in his location due to snowfall. They both agreed they dislike winter and wish it were summer. Joe asked about tomorrow's forecast, which was predicted to be snowy again.

Conversation: Mom , I just finished my paper . Can you proofread it before I hand it in ? Sure , let ’ s take a look . Sweetie , this is terrific . Your ideas are so original . Thanks . I can tell you worked hard on it . I really did ! I started thinking about what I wanted to say three weeks ago . Well , it was definitely worth all the time . Let ’ s just hope my teacher agrees .
Summaries: The student finishes their paper and asks their mom to proofread it before submitting. The mom is impressed, praising the original ideas and effort put into the work. She expresses gratitude for her child's hard work, specifically mentioning that they started thinking about the topic three weeks prior.

Conversation: How about doing shopping this weekend ? What're you going to buy ? Sportshoes.Will you go with me ? OK .
Summaries: The conversation starts by suggesting doing some shopping on the weekend. The person is planning to buy sports shoes. They then invite someone else to join them, and that person agrees.

Conversation: Merry Christmas ! Huh ? I said Merry Christmas ! Don't you know that Christmas is almost here ? It is ? Oh , that's nice . Huh ? Didn't you know ? Aren't you excited ? Actually , I'd forgotten about it . Forgotten about it ? How could you ? Because I'm not Christian , I'm Jewish . Oh , I'm sorry . I didn't know . It's all right . There are so many Christians in America that everybody takes it for granted that I'm Christian . I guess so . So what do you do around this time of year ? Well , I'll celebrate Hanukah soon , but that's not as important to us as Christmas is to you . Mainly I'll just enjoy the holiday break . Well , would you be horribly offended if I invited you to a Christmas party at my house ? Not at all . A party is a party . I'll be happy to come .
Summaries: The speaker wishes someone "Merry Christmas" and is met with surprise and confusion. The person reveals they are Jewish and have forgotten about Christmas, which wasn't a big deal to them since they don't celebrate it. The speaker explains that many Christians in America take Christmas for granted, assuming everyone celebrates it. The conversation ends with the idea of inviting someone to a Christmas party at their house, which is seen as a non-issue despite being a different cultural celebration.

Conversation: It's all over . I'm bankrupt . Don't worry . Everything will be fine .
Summaries: The speaker has gone bankrupt, but is trying to reassure others that everything will be okay.

Conversation: Bill , Happy Halloween ! Happy Halloween ! What creature are you going to dress up as ? I will dress up as a vampire with big fangs . May I have a look at your costume ? Sure . Wait a moment . ( Several minutes later ) Here you are . I like your black clothes and your fangs are cool . I will bite many beautiful girls on the neck tonight . Maybe I will suck their blood . Haha . Wish you good luck .

Bill jokingly mentions that he'll bite many beautiful girls on the neck tonight, possibly even sucking their blood. He wishes his friend good luck, likely referring to their Halloween night activities.

Conversation: I think that ’ s settled . I'm tired of your cut-and-dried opinions . Who do you think you are ! How dare you speak to me like this . Why not ?
Summaries: The speaker appears to be fed up with someone else's straightforward and unyielding views, feeling belittled and disrespected. They're questioning the other person's authority and challenging their right to make judgments or criticisms, expressing frustration and indignation.

Conversation: Hey , Karen . Look like you got some sun this weekend . Yeah ? I guess so . I spent the weekend at beach . That ’ s great . Where did you stay ? Some friends of my parents live out there , and they invited me there . So , what did you do out there ? I mean besides bask in the sun , obviously . I jogged up and down the beach and played volleyball . You know I never realized how hard it is to run on sand . I couldn ’ t get through a whole game before I had to sit down . Not to mention cooler . Did you go swimming ? I wanted to , but the water is too cold , and I just wetted in up to my knees . It all sounds so relaxing . I wish I could get away to the beach like that . It looks like you could use it . Don ’ t tell me you spent the weekend in the library again .
Summaries: Karen and her friend are discussing their weekend. Karen spent time at the beach, where she jogged, played volleyball, and got some sun. Her friend asked about accommodations, and Karen mentioned staying with friends of her parents. The friend expressed interest in going to the beach themselves, citing the relaxing atmosphere and desire to get away from daily routines.

Conversation: OK class , so today we are going to continue with our anatomy class , today we will review everything we have learned . Can anyone tell me what the first major organ is ? The brain ! That's right , the brain ! It serves as a control center for the body , handling the processes of the central nervous system as well as cognition . Then what major organ is in our chest ? The heart ! Very good ! It pumps blood throughout the body , using the circulatory system such as blood vessels and veins . Now let's not forget that our lungs provide oxygen to our heart and body to keep us alive ! Now what about the organs that help us digest food ? The stomach and intestines ! Very good ! Let's not forget that the stomach is the one that breaks down our food and our intestines process that food and then expel the waste . Are we forgetting anything ? Yeah ! Our kidneys , liver and bladder ! Oh yes , you are right . Very important organs indeed . So what do these organs do , teacher ? Well , mumm , they ... Time for a break ! We can talk about it when you get back .
Summaries: The class reviewed major organs in the human body, starting with the brain as the control center for the central nervous system and cognition. The heart was mentioned as pumping blood throughout the body using the circulatory system. Lungs were discussed as providing oxygen to the heart and body. The stomach and intestines were highlighted as responsible for digesting food, breaking it down and processing waste. Finally, the kidneys, liver, and bladder were mentioned as important organs involved in filtering waste, detoxifying the blood, and eliminating excess fluids.

Conversation: It's not good for business recently . Not good for business ? I don't see eye to eye with you.The new policy offers new opportunities . Too risky anyway.It ' s necessary to look before you leap .
Summaries: The conversation is about a recent business development that the speaker doesn't think is beneficial. The interlocutor disagrees, seeing potential opportunities in the new policy. However, the speaker believes it's too risky and suggests cautioning before making any moves, emphasizing the importance of careful consideration (looking before leaping).

Conversation: Do you know how to play go ? It's easy . All you have to do is to use your pieces to surround the opponent's pieces and then take over all of his territory . But I heard it is very difficult to play . It's easier said than done . When you actually play , it can be very frustrating .
Summaries: Go is a game where players aim to surround their opponent's pieces to gain territory. While the objective sounds simple, playing Go can be challenging and frustrating in practice. Despite its ease of concept, the game requires strategy and skill to execute effectively.

Conversation: Linda ? Is that you ? I haven't seen you in ages ! Hi George ! It's good to see you ! What have you been up to ? I just opened up my own business not long ago . Good for you ! What are you doing ? I'm a professional party planner here in the city . I do catering and all that . I knew some day I would be able to profit from your love of fun ! Well , I don't know about the profit part yet . But I am really having fun !
Summaries: Two friends, Linda (assumed) and George, reconnect after ages. Linda shares her new business venture as a professional party planner in the city, specializing in catering and event planning. She's enjoying herself despite not yet seeing profits.

Conversation: So , what ’ s new in the kitchen ? That refrigerator is new , isn ’ t it ? Yes . I needed a large one . Before , I had a separate refrigerator and freezer , but this has both combined into one . That ’ s usual nowadays . You ’ Ve added a few shelves too . Yes . You know I ’ Ve been cooking more kind of food recently and I needed some extra space for spices and ingredients . Did you buy new cupboards too ? No , I didn ’ t . I gave them a really good clean , so they just look new . The worktop was in poor condition , so I had a new one added . I see that you have bought several new pots and pans and utensils . Yes , I have . I need them to help me with these new dished I ’ m trying to make . I need a little more practice before I invite guests over . Looking at the spice rack , I ’ d say you ’ Ve been learning how to make asian food . Yes . I ’ Ve always likes Indian and thai food , so I ’ Ve been trying to make dishes from those countries . I ’ m pretty good at making curries now , but I still need practice at making thai food . Both kinds of food are becoming popular.Nowadays , it ’ s very easy to pick up the ingredients at the supermarket . I hope you can stay for dinner . I need a guinea pig !

They've also added extra shelves for spices and ingredients. The speaker has acquired new pots, pans, and utensils to help them practice cooking new dishes, specifically Indian and Thai cuisine. They're still working on perfecting their skills before inviting guests over.

Conversation: How do you like skiing , Pat ? I love it . All my life I wanted to learn to ski . Finally I took lessons last year . I suppose skiing is easy for you . No , quite the opposite . I thought I'd never stop falling down . Then all of a sudden I started skiing much better . I see . Do you ski often ? Every chance I get . On weekends I ski all day long . Sometimes I even ski at night . That sounds great . Oh , yes . The ski slopes are well lit . It's really nice to ski at night . Why don't you learn to ski ? Not on your life ! I know I'd break my leg Don't be so frightened . It's just a skill .
Summaries: Pat and an unnamed speaker discuss their shared love of skiing. The speaker reveals they learned to ski last year after wanting to do so their whole life, but initially struggled with falling down. Pat, who has been skiing for some time, shares that they enjoy it every chance they get, even skiing at night when the slopes are well-lit. When asked why he hasn't taught his friend to ski, Pat jokingly replies that he knows his friend would break their leg if they tried!

Conversation: Hi , Dave . This is Zina . Zina ? Zina the Snake ? I got your e-mail a couple of months back . Yeah ? Which one was that ? The one that said , You're a creep . From me you won't hear another peep . I hope you wreck your jeep . Right . That one . Did it work ?
Summaries: Zina, seemingly the "Snake" from an earlier email exchange with Dave. She sent an email calling him a creep and threatening to never contact him again. The email also included a wish for his Jeep to be wrecked.

Conversation: Hello , my name is Bill Martin and we have a reservation for party tonight . Yes , what can I do for you ? I need to cancel that . We have had a last minute change of plans . I see . Would you like me to reschedule you for another night ? OK , we will let you know as early as possible . By the way , will we be able to get a refund on this cancellation ? Certainly . Thank you very much . That's all right . I hope we can help you at some other time . Good-bye . Good-bye .
Summaries: Bill Martin cancels a reservation due to a last-minute change in plans. The establishment offers to reschedule for another night or provide a refund. The cancellation is accepted and the party is thanked for their understanding.

Conversation: Can I use your laptop for a while ? Sure , go ahead . Oh , isn't your computer Wi-Fi capable ? Yes , it is . You want go online ? there are no wi-fi hotspots around . Oh my , no internet access is killing me . Can't you wait till you get home ? then you can surf the internet using the broadband , wireless connection or whatever you like . No , I'm not feeling myself . I just want to check my emails , visit my favorite websites and chat with my friends . Now I see , you must be suffering from discomgoogolation . What does that mean ? there's nothing wrong with me . Well , the term ' discomgoogolation ' comes from ' discombobulate ' and ' google ' . Because floods of information are just a mouse click away , net users are very likely to become addicted to the web . That's alright . I just can't bear losing track of all the latest information . It almost drives me crazy . Then , you're probably addicted .
Summaries: The speaker asks to use someone else's laptop without Wi-Fi and expresses distress at not having internet access. The other person suggests waiting until they get home to use their broadband connection, but the speaker insists on checking emails and visiting websites immediately due to feelings of discomgoogolation (addiction to the internet).

Conversation: Sally , I ’ m tired of this Western food . I really miss my mother ’ s Sichuan cooking . I ’ m sure you do miss that type of cooking . But can ’ t you try to get used to Western food ? I have tried . But Americans like butter , bread , sugar , and cream too much . I suppose you ’ re right , Lee . Maybe that ’ s why so many Westerners are overweight . It ’ s interesting that Americans work very hard at their jobs , do not take naps during the day , and yet they can be so heavy . You see , because we are often busy working , we eat too much fast food , and that food is very fattening .
Summaries: The speaker, Lee, is tired of Western food and misses their mother's Sichuan cooking. They suggest Sally may not like it either. Lee notes that Americans tend to overindulge in butter, bread, sugar, and cream, which can contribute to weight issues despite working hard and not taking naps during the day.

Conversation: Tell me something about your Valentine's Day . Ok , on that day , boys usually give roses to the sweet hearts and girls give them chocolate to return . So romantic . Young people must have lot of fun . Yeah , that is the holiday is hot , isn't it ?
Summaries: Valentine's Day is a romantic holiday where boys typically gift roses to their loved ones, while girls reciprocate with chocolates. The holiday is considered "hot" and young people are expected to have a lot of fun celebrating it.

Conversation: What will happen to the children if you break up ? That's a relief for me and a misery for the children . Why don't you make up with John . It's too late .
Summaries: The speaker is discussing the potential consequences of a breakup on children. They express relief at the prospect of not having to deal with the emotional impact of a divorce, but acknowledge that it would be devastating for the children involved. The conversation also touches on the idea of reconciliation, specifically whether it's too late to make amends and repair relationships.

Conversation: Have you ever been to Japan ? I'm going in the fall . Yeah , I've been there twice . Really ? Tell me about it . What's it like ? Oh , it's fantastic . Where did you go ? On my first trip I went to Tokyo , and on my second trip I visited Kyoto . What did you think of Tokyo ? Very big and exciting , but very crowded , too . Yeah . I've seen pictures of the crowds ! And the restaurant are excellent ... but they're kind of expensive . And how about Kyoto ? Kyoto is lovely . It's full of beautiful old temples and gardens.It ' s a very historic city . How was the weather ? I was in Tokyo in August , and it was really hot and humid . I went to Kyoto in October.It was hot and sunny , but there was no humidity . Sounds perfect . I can't wait !
Summaries: The speaker has been to Japan twice, visiting Tokyo and Kyoto. They describe Tokyo as "very big and exciting" but also very crowded. Restaurants in Tokyo are excellent, but pricey. In contrast, Kyoto is "lovely", with beautiful old temples and gardens, and a rich history. The weather varied between trips: August in Tokyo was hot and humid, while October in Kyoto was hot and sunny with no humidity.

Conversation: Where do you live now ? I live in Haitian District where there are lot of universities . Which street do you live on ? I live at No . 50 Xingu Street .
Summaries: The speaker currently resides in the Haitian District, which is known for its numerous universities. The exact location is 50 Xingu Street.

Conversation: Who did the stupid thing ? Maybe it was Dick . I don't think so . Dick has been on the ball and never does things like that . Then it must be a naughty boy who did it .
Summaries: The speaker is trying to figure out who did something foolish, initially suggesting it might have been someone named Dick. However, they quickly dismiss this idea as Dick is responsible and would not do such a thing. Instead, the speaker concludes that it was likely a mischievous or naughty individual who committed the error.

Conversation: Can I help you ? Yes . I'd like to borrow these books . Just a second . I'll see if I can find them for you . Thanks . Here you are . You must return them within a month . What happens if I'm not finished with them in a month ? You can come in and renew them unless someone else has reserved them . OK.Thank you very much for your trouble . No trouble at all . So long .
Summaries: A person wants to borrow some books from a library. The librarian checks if the books are available and then lends them out with a condition that they must be returned within a month. If the person isn't finished with the books by the end of the month, they can come back and renew them as long as no one else has reserved the books.

Conversation: Hi Sam , would you like to come for a curry with us next Friday ? Sure , I love curry . Who else is coming ? Jane , Susan , Pete and two colleagues of mine from work . I have no plans for Friday , so curry would be great . Which restaurant do you have in mind ? Susan suggested the one on Main Street . She says it is very good . Which one is that ? You know , the one just on the corner with Oxford Street . There is a large pharmacy next door . Oh yes , I know which one you mean . I have never been there , but I looked at their menu once and it did look good . Okay then . I think we will all meet outside ? What time ? At 8 o'clock . I will make the reservation . That's good . See you on Friday .

They plan to meet outside at 8pm, and Susan has suggested the restaurant on the corner with Oxford Street, which has a large pharmacy next door.

Conversation: Did you have a part-time job when you were still in school ? No , I was way too busy studying all the time . How about you ? Conversation: Did you like the play ? Not really . It's a dull one , and the production isn't satisfactory , either . You're absolutely right . The acting could be better . To be fair , though , both the costumes and scenery are marvelous .
Summaries: The conversationalists express disappointment with the play, finding it dull and the production lacking. They agree that the acting could be improved. However, they do praise the costumes and scenery as exceptional.

Conversation: I need some books on hardware . There's many books here.What about these ? Great ! They're the very books I want.May I borrow two books ? Sure.But you can only keep them for a week . I see.Thank you .
Summaries: A person asks to borrow some hardware-related books from someone. The person agrees and offers to lend two books, but specifies that they need to be returned within a week.

Conversation: I don ’ t know why I married him . What is the matter ? He never see eye to eye with me . That is to say , love is blind .
Summaries: The speaker expresses uncertainty about their marriage and frustration that they don't have a harmonious relationship. They describe their partner as someone who consistently disagrees with them, suggesting a lack of emotional connection or understanding. The phrase "love is blind" implies that the speaker may have ignored these issues in order to love their partner, but now struggles to make sense of their marriage.

Conversation: Why is the long face ? I'm getting sick of work man . I can't take the political bull in the company any more . Did you just get your review or something ? Yeah , but that's not why I am upset . I just found out another guy got a promotion . He doesn't know how to do anything . He sits there and kisses the managers butt all day long . That sucks . I'm just pissed that management can't see behind his smooth talking lies . Look on the bright side . At least you have a job . Yeah . I shouldn't stress about this anymore . It's not like I can do anything about it . Exactly . Instead , we should have some drinks tonight . How about a cold bottle of beer . Now you're talking .
Summaries: The conversation starts with one person expressing frustration and exhaustion with work due to the company's politics. They're upset that another colleague, who they deem unqualified, received a promotion likely due to brown-nosing management. The speaker feels stuck and can't do anything about it. To take their mind off things, they suggest having drinks and sharing a cold beer.

Conversation: You're so witty ... So why is the face tilted to the right ? This watch is supposed to be worn on your left hand . So it's not as convenient for left-handed people ? It's better for right-handed people like me . See , I don't even have to move my arm to see the time . I'm left-handed . You bought that watch so that I won't borrow it ... Bingo !
Summaries: The conversation revolves around a watch with a tilted face, which is inconvenient for left-handed individuals. The speaker (left-handed) points out that the watch is designed to be worn on the left hand, making it more suitable for right-handed people like the listener. The speaker reveals that they bought the watch to prevent borrowing and cleverly implies that they already knew this would be the case ("Bingo!").

Conversation: Is there any ticket left for tonight's concert ? I am sorry , sir.All the tickets have been sold out . What a shame . Will there be the same performance tomorrow evening ? Sorry , sir . The only tickets of the same performance available are on 21st . That's fine . I want 2 tickets .
Summaries: The speaker inquires about ticket availability for tonight's concert. Unfortunately, all tickets have been sold out (shame). However, there is a possibility to attend the same performance tomorrow evening on the 21st, which can accommodate the request for 2 tickets.

Conversation: Does Tom drink a lot ? Yes , he does . He of ten has had one to many . But I advised him not to drink too much , he just boasted that he had hollow legs and nobody had ever drunk him under the table . That's a problem . He has sort of Dutch courage and that will egg him on in doing anything .
Summaries: Tom has a tendency to overdrink, often having one too many. Despite being advised not to drink excessively, Tom boasts about his ability to handle large amounts of alcohol without getting drunk, which can lead to reckless behavior due to "Dutch courage".

Conversation: Do you offer a course in business management ? Yes , we do . How many nights a week is it ? It's 3 nights a week , Monday , Tuesday and Thursday . And how long does the course last ? It lasts for 9 months . When does it start ? The next beginning class starts on October 25th . What time is the class ? From 7 to 9 o'clock . How much does it cost ? It costs 125 dollars a month . Yes , that's all right . I want to enroll in the course . Thank you , please fill out this form for us . Do you want me to fill it out now ? Yes , please . We need a record of you education and your work experiences .
Summaries: The company offers a 9-month business management course, meeting three nights a week (Monday, Tuesday, Thursday) from 7-9 PM. The next class starts on October 25th and costs $125 per month. To enroll, you need to fill out a form providing information about your education and work experiences.

Conversation: How many passengers are there aboard the ship ? Seventy-six , I think .
Summaries: There are 76 passengers on board the ship.

Conversation: What ’ s your schedule like this year ? Pretty busy . I have to pick up a lot of credits this year . What ’ s your major ? I ’ m majoring in French literature . We got the assignment last week . When is it due ? Next Monday ! Remind me never to sign up for that course !

The other speaker reminds them about a difficult class on 18th century poetry, which requires a 100-page paper due next Monday.

Conversation: Okay , next question . If Eric asked you out on a date , what would you say ? Duh ! I would say yes ! Eric is the most popular kid in school ! Okay , my turn . My dad will freak out if I even mention a trip like that ! Alright this is a good one . What would your mom say if you told her you are going to get married ? If I told her that , she would faint and have me committed !

The friend reveals their dream trip after winning the lottery, which includes going around the world. Finally, the speaker jokes about what would happen if they told their mom they're getting married, saying she'd be shocked and worried for their sanity.

Conversation: Something wrong ? Yes . My car is having problems . What's wrong ? It won't start . Do you want me to take a look ? No , thank you . I think I can handle it . Well , if you change your mind , let me know . I will . Thanks . That's sweet of you . No problem . I might need some tools though . Do you know where I can get some ? Sure . I have all kinds of tools . Just ask . I ’ ll be happy to get them for you . Thanks . That would be very helpful . Anything for you . Seriously , I don ’ t mind helping . OK . If you really insist , I could always use the company .
Summaries: A person is having trouble with their car, which won't start. They initially decline help from someone else, but then ask for assistance in getting tools to fix the issue. The helper offers to provide the necessary tools and even invites themselves along to keep the person company while they work on the car.

Conversation: I've been standing here since half past seven . Where on earth have you been ? I'm terribly sorry I'm late . I just couldn't help it . It's really very easy saying you're sorry . Look , just give me a chance . I can explain it .
Summaries: The speaker has arrived late and is apologetic, having stood outside for over 30 minutes. They claim to have been detained unexpectedly and are seeking an opportunity to explain the circumstances of their tardiness.

Conversation: Dalian is a beautiful city . Do you agree ? I suppose I do . The climate here is pleasant . They use said it This city is really comfortable to living . It sure is No other city can match it . It's heaven . Well , if you live in other as long enough you love them just as much . Maybe . That's for sure .
Summaries: The speaker and the respondent agree that Dalian is a beautiful city with a pleasant climate, making it comfortable to live in. They both express admiration for the city, with one person stating it's "heaven". However, they also acknowledge that people may develop a sense of attachment to other cities as well, after spending enough time there.

Conversation: Do you know that Mary an Ben have already separated ? Yeah , I know . I didn ’ t know it until yesterday . I put my foot into it , and was even stupid enough to ask when they would get married .
Summaries: The speaker mentions that Mary and Ben have already separated, revealing that the person wasn't aware of this until recently. The speaker shares their own embarrassing experience, admitting to putting their foot in it by asking when Mary and Ben would get married, despite knowing they were no longer together.

Conversation: Alice , your father is amazing . He ’ s 90 years old and he lives alone in that big house . I know . He doesn ’ t like to ask anyone for help . My dad insists on paying his own bills and taking care of himself ! That sounds like my Grandmother . She was always stubbornly independent . It seems that folks like my father and your grandmother are determined to be on their own . They see their independence as a kind of character strength . Sometimes they are too independent .
Summaries: A person (Alice) discusses her 90-year-old father who lives alone and insists on paying his own bills and taking care of himself, valuing his independence. This trait is similar to Alice's grandmother, who was also stubbornly independent. While this can be seen as a positive character strength, it may sometimes lead to being too independent.

Conversation: How are you making out ? I'm doing fine.Don ' t mind me.It ' s a wonderful birthday party.Everyone is enjoying himself . I hope so . Thank you again for your delightful gift . Don't mention it .
Summaries: The person is having a great time at their birthday party, where everyone is enjoying themselves. They express gratitude to someone (likely the speaker) for a thoughtful gift and reassure them that it was appreciated.

Conversation: Happy Birthday , Mary ! Thank you . Here is a gift for you . I hope you like it . What a lovely dog ! How did you know I love this ? I had my own ways of finding out . It's a secret . You look so beautiful today . Your new shirt goes well with your skirt . Maybe you don't believe it , but it was made by my grandmother . Really ? It looks so nice . Thank you . Please have a cup of tea . All right . How about some fish ? No , thanks . I've had enough . Now , Mary , before you blow out the birthday candles , you have to make a wish . After that , you may cut the cake . OK , let me make a wish ... Do you want a big piece of cake ? No , just a small one . Next let's sing ' Happy Birthday ' to Mary . It is very kind of you . I'm so moved by you .
Summaries: The speaker wishes Mary a happy birthday, thanks her, and presents her with a gift (a dog). They reveal they knew Mary loved dogs because they had their own ways of finding out (secretly). The speaker compliments Mary's outfit, revealing it was made by their grandmother. They offer tea and fish, but Mary declines. Before blowing out the candles, the speaker asks Mary to make a wish, after which she can cut the cake. The conversation ends with the group singing "Happy Birthday" to Mary.

Conversation: How did you meet your girlfriend ? I met Amanda through a friend . That's great . Did you start dating right after you met , or did you become friends first ? We started dating right away .
Summaries: I met my girlfriend Amanda through a mutual friend. We didn't take the time to become friends first, instead we started dating immediately.

Conversation: Is there anything available for tonight ? There are some seats in the rear mezzanine . Isn't there anything else available ? No , the show is almost sold out .
Summaries: The speaker asks if there are any tickets available for that night, and the response is that there are some limited seats in the rear mezzanine. However, it's clarified that those are the only remaining options as the show is almost sold out.

Conversation: I haven't seen your father in like 5 years . How is he doing ? He's not doing too well . Why ? What's wrong ? About a year ago , he started feeling weak all the time . Is it due to old age or is he sick . Maybe a little of both . The doctor's can't point out anything specifically . I think it is because he didn't take care of himself during his youth . That makes sense . It's important to take care of your health early in life . That's what my father tells me almost everyday . Well , I hope he starts feeling better . Say hi to him for me . Thanks . I'll let him know .
Summaries: The speaker hasn't seen their father in 5 years and has recently been informed that his health isn't good. The issue started about a year ago when he began feeling weak all the time, possibly due to a combination of old age and lifestyle choices. Despite doctor's visits, no specific cause was identified. The speaker believes their father's lack of self-care in his youth may be contributing to his poor health.

Conversation: Wedding rings ! Oh , no ... Aren't they cool ? I like the settings . Jen , is there someone you're not telling me about ? No . I just like looking at wedding rings , OK ? Women are such dreamers . These are specially designed for the year 2000 !
Summaries: The conversation starts with excitement and admiration for wedding rings, specifically mentioning their cool settings. The person (Jen) is asked if she's hiding something, to which she denies any romantic involvement. It's mentioned that women have a tendency to be idealistic or dreamers. Finally, it's noted that the specific ring designs are intended for the year 2000.

Conversation: Hurry up , get in . I ’ m in , let ’ s go ! OK , make a left here . . . no wait , I meant make a right . Come on , speed up ! Geez ! What ’ s the rush ? Don ’ t worry about it , just drive . Oh , no , the light is about to change . . . step on it ! Are you nuts ! I ’ m not going to run a red light ! Whatever . Just turn right here . . . . The freeway will be packed at this hour . . . . let ’ s take a side street.Go on ! Get out of our way ! Move , move ! What ’ s your problem ! Geez . Having a fit is not going to help ! Here , I know a short cut ... just go down here , and we ’ ll cut though Ashburn Heights . Let ’ s go , let ’ s go ! Watch out for that lady ! I ’ m going as fast as I can ! Yes ! We made it . 5:58 , just before the library closes . You ’ re such a geek !
Summaries: Two people are in a car, trying to rush to their destination. The driver is anxious and giving directions, while the passenger is concerned about running red lights and being safe. They take a detour to avoid traffic and use a shortcut through Ashburn Heights. They finally arrive at 5:58 PM just before the library closes, with the passenger joking that they're "such a geek" for rushing to get there on time.

Conversation: I've heard so much about Japan . Is it a beautiful country ? Not everyone thinks Japan is beautiful , but to me its beauty is breathtaking.You feel the same way about France , don't you ? Yes , I do feel the same way about France . The swift rivers , the fertile valleys , the large cities-its scenery is beautiful . Will you describe the geography of Japan ? Well , it's made up of four large islands and many smaller islands located off the coast of the Asian main lands . France isn't an island , is it ? Oh , no , France isn't an island . It is located in the western part of the European continent . But France does have many fine harbors and port cities on its southern and western coasts . Does Japan have good harbors ? Good harbors ! Yokohama is one of the most famous port cities in the world , and Japan is the largest shipbuilding nation in the world . Also , there are long mountain ranges in the southern is hands . France isn't very mountainous , is it ? No , France isn't very mountainous . But it does contain the Pyrenees , a large mountain range with high peaks and deep canyons . What kind of Climate does Japan have ? The Japanese climate is warm and moist in the south , mild in the central part and cold in the north . Except for Hokkaido , we don't get much snowfall at all . France has a mild climate , doesn't it ? Yes , the climate of France rarely has severe winters . In southern France , one can live in comfort the whole year . Is Japan good for farming ? Yes , Japan is good for farming . Rice is the main crop , but Japan is also an industrial center . Fishing is very important , too . Rice isn't grown in France , is it ? No , rice isn't grown in France . But farming , fishing and industry are also very important in France . I'd like to go to Japan some day . Would you like to visit France ? Yes . I'd like to visit France . I'd like to travel all over the world . As you describe it , France seems to be very much like Japan . I would like to see it for myself .
Summaries: The speaker discusses the beauty of Japan, comparing it to France. They highlight Japan's geography, mentioning its four main islands and many smaller islands off the coast of Asia. The conversation also touches on Japan's climate, describing it as warm and moist in the south, mild in the center, and cold in the north. The speaker notes that farming, fishing, and industry are important sectors in Japan, with rice being a major crop. They express interest in visiting Japan and mention their desire to travel globally, noting similarities between France and Japan.

Conversation: I don't know why Mark often comes to me and asks me for advice . I smell some rat in it . He is sly . He is actually angling for compliments . But he may have got the crush on you . Nonsense ! There's no indication that he's in love with me . Keep your fingers crossed . He may pop the question one of these days .
Summaries: The speaker is skeptical about Mark seeking their advice, suspecting he's actually looking for compliments rather than genuine guidance. They dismiss the idea that Mark might have romantic feelings for them, citing a lack of indication. Despite this, they humorously suggest keeping fingers crossed in case Mark surprises everyone and proposes someday.

Conversation: Hi , why do you look so depressed today , Mike ? I had a terrible quarrel with my neighbor yesterday . How come ? It is a long story . Basically , she thought I had laughed at her while I didn't . I know everyone suffers when he is misunderstood . But why not take it easy ? Yeah . It's so nice of you to comfort me .
Summaries: Mike looks depressed and has a quarrel with his neighbor due to a misunderstanding. His neighbor thought he laughed at her, but actually he didn't. He knows everyone suffers when they're misunderstood and appreciates someone comforting him.

Conversation: Maybe we'd better go now . It's still early . Gosh , it's already 10.Stay here if you like . Since we're late , let's go to see a film . OK.Hurry up .
Summaries: The conversation is about going out, and the time is already 10 am. The speaker suggests leaving since they're running late. They then propose watching a movie together as an alternative activity. The other person agrees and urges the speaker to hurry up.

Conversation: My uncle passed away last night . My condolences .
Summaries: A loved one has passed away, and my deepest condolences are offered to the family during this difficult time.

Conversation: Diana , in your opinion , which is more important , IQ or EQ ? Why are you asking me the strange question , Jerry ? I watched the movie Forrest Gump last night . And the question just lined in my mind . Well . I think IQ matters more . But it won't work without EQ . Why ? You seem pretty sure about it . Because an intellectual mind can only be a beneficial thing in life . But IQ is decided at birth.One can't expect to make a lot of improvement in it . That's why people's achievement varies greatly . That ' s true , but what if one comes across some difficulties . He must rely on his EQ to deal with them . Yes , Jerry , can you share your understanding of EQ ? I think it is independent of IQ and plays a prominent role in deciding the way we live our lives . Quite right . Have you noticed that a high IQ is not a must for one's success ? Just as Forrest ? Yes , his IQ is high enough for him to embrace the success as long as he can manage his EQ . I got it .
Summaries: Diana and Jerry discuss which is more important, IQ (Intelligence Quotient) or EQ (Emotional Intelligence Quotient). Diana initially thinks IQ matters more, but notes that EQ is also crucial. She believes IQ is fixed at birth, so people's achievements vary greatly. However, she acknowledges that EQ plays a key role in dealing with difficulties and achieving success. Jerry agrees, pointing out that Forrest Gump, despite having a high IQ, only succeeded because of his ability to manage his EQ.

Conversation: Come on ! It's time to go ! Wait a minute ! Just hold your horses ! What's your hurry , anyway ? Well , I've got to stop and get gas in the car , first . That won't take long . Well , it won't if there no line at the pump . Well , I'm not quite ready . I'll give you five more minutes , then I'm going on without you ! You wouldn't do a thing like that ! Oh , yes , I would !
Summaries: The speaker is delaying departure to stop and get gas in their car. They're aware they might not have time for this if there's a long line at the pump. After initially agreeing to give the other person 5 minutes, they threaten to leave without them if they're still not ready after that.

Conversation: How's business ? So so .
Summaries: The conversation is about the state of a business, which is described as "so so", implying that it's neither excellent nor poor, but rather average.

Conversation: Wow , that terrible movie is finally over . Next time I ’ m picking the film , because I don ’ t want to end up seeing a chick flick . Well you should have picked , in the end you always complain about everything . Not everything , just this film . Even the title is ridiculous . and it ’ s so long , those are the two and a half most wasted hours of my life , so much so that I ’ m thinking about asking them to give me my money back . I ’ m thinking of taking you back home . I thought we could have a nice evening , but you ’ re always so negative . I ’ m only complaining about a movie that I could have rented or bought and then thrown in the garbage . You see , that ’ s what I ’ m talking about , I can ’ t stand your sarcastic jokes anymore Next time , go with your gay friend who is more in touch with his feelings . Well he ’ s more of a man than you are ; at least he appreciates love stories . Love stories ? More like one-night-stands . Don ’ t criticize Mario or else I ’ ll start on those fat , drunk friends of yours ; they ’ re no saints . My friends ? Fat ? What about those whales you call friends ? You ’ re unbearable ; you can walk home , I ’ m leaving .
Summaries: The speaker is upset about watching a romantic movie that they consider terrible. They blame their friend for picking it and criticize the title, length, and overall quality of the film. The conversation quickly turns negative as both friends start criticizing each other. The speaker feels their friend is too critical and sarcastic, while their friend thinks they're being overly negative and unable to appreciate love stories. The argument escalates until one friend storms off, leaving the other feeling upset and frustrated.

Conversation: Which language do you speak ? Well , I studied French at school , but I ’ Ve forgotten most of it . I learnt some Russian while I was studying there and now I study Spanish in evening classes . Do you speak Japanese at home with your parents ? Yes , I do . I ’ m learning Chinese now on the internet . How do you find studying a language on the internet ? It ’ s not easy , particularly with listening and speaking , because sometimes the connection isn ’ t too good . I bet you find the character difficult to write ! Actually , many of the characters are the same or very similar in both Chinese and Japanese , so they ’ re easy for me . So , you can read and write much better than you speak and understand other speakers , right ? Yes . How are the Spanish classes going ? In a way , it ’ s similar to your experience of learning Chinese . Some Spanish words are very similar to English ones . But I need to practise listening to native speakers and saying the words myself .
Summaries: The conversation is about languages. The speaker has studied French, learned some Russian, and currently studies Spanish in evening classes. They also learn Chinese online. Despite some difficulties with internet-based learning, they find it helpful for reading and writing, which are similar to Japanese characters they're familiar with. The speaker notes that their speaking skills are not as strong as their reading and writing abilities, and they need more practice listening to native speakers to improve their Spanish pronunciation.

Conversation: Why didn't you tell me you had a girlfriend ? Sorry , I thought you knew . But you should tell me you were in love with her . Didn't I ? You know you didn't . Well , I am telling you now . Yes , but you might have told me before . I didn't think you would be interested . You can't be serious . How dare you not tell me you are going to marry her ? Sorry , I didn't think it mattered . Oh , you men ! You are all the same .
Summaries: A person is upset because they feel they were kept in the dark about someone else's romantic relationship. They express surprise and hurt that they weren't informed sooner and didn't even get a hint about the other person's intentions to marry their partner. The conversation is marked by defensiveness and frustration, with both parties feeling misunderstood and unappreciated.

Conversation: So , did you go out with Richard ? Yeah . We went to a movie last Saturday . We saw Police Partners II . Did you like it ? Richard did , but I didn't . Of course , I told him I liked it . Yeah . So did you do anything else ? Well , we went to a dance club . Did you have fun there ? Yeah , we had a great time . And we're going to go there again next week !
Summaries: The speaker went out with Richard, watching Police Partners II and then visiting a dance club. They both enjoyed themselves at the club and are planning to return next week.

Conversation: Would you like to go to work or continue your studies after graduation ? I think I will continue my studies . Now it's not easy for a graduate with bachelor's degree to get a job since there are so many graduates with master's or doctor's degree . We are likely to lose in competing with them in the job market . So you will continue to study for a master's degree ? Well , I think so . But I am thinking of going aboard to get a master's and doctor's degree . If can get a Ph . D . abroad , it will be much easy for me to get a job at home . How can you finance your education abroad ? It is very expensive to study abroad . I think I will try to get the scholarship since I really don't have so much money to study abroad . Actually now I am preparing for the TEFL and GRE exams . If I can get high marks in the two exams and if I am lucky enough , I may get a scholarship . It could be pretty tough studying abroad . Being so far away from home ...
Summaries: A graduate is considering continuing their studies after receiving a bachelor's degree due to the competitive job market. They're likely to pursue a master's or doctorate abroad to increase their chances of getting hired at home. The goal is to obtain a Ph.D. and finance their education through scholarships, as studying abroad can be expensive. Preparation for TEFL and GRE exams is underway in hopes of securing a scholarship.

Conversation: It's hard to get tickets for the movie . Did you get any ? Yeah , two at the tenth rows . How much is the ticket ? 3.5 dollars each .
Summaries: The speaker found it difficult to obtain tickets for the movie, but managed to secure two seats in the 10th row. The cost per ticket was $3.50.

Conversation: What a great weekend that was ! My feeling's exactly . I really enjoy the beach in the summer . I couldn't agree with you more . We should come here more often . You are absolutely right . I'd like to come back next weekend .
Summaries: The speaker and someone else shared positive feelings about a great weekend spent at the beach. They both enjoyed the summer weather and agree that it's a wonderful experience. The speaker suggests returning to the beach next weekend, echoing their companion's sentiment that they should come back more often.

Conversation: I think Andy's party will be fun . Yeah , I think so . Oh , by the way , I need to ask you something . What's that ? Could I get back the sweater you borrowed ? Sure . Oh , that reminds me . Could I borrow your black leather boots ? My boots ? Er ... Sure , ok .
Summaries: The conversation is about Andy's party and borrowing items. The speaker thinks the party will be fun, and agrees to lend their friend a sweater they had borrowed from them previously. They then ask to borrow the friend's black leather boots in return.

Conversation: Hi , Mr . Smith . Are you enjoying the cookout ? You don't look too happy . I spent the morning at the cemetery . I put flowers on the graves of my old war buddies . Is that what people usually do on Memorial Day ? They should . This holiday is about remembering our war dead . But people these days think it's just a holiday for summer sales and cookouts ! I'm sorry to hear that . Thank you for telling me a little more about it .
Summaries: Mr. Smith, a veteran, reflects on Memorial Day while attending a cookout, expressing disappointment that many people view the holiday as just a reason for sales and outdoor gatherings, rather than a time to remember and honor those who have died in war. He shares his personal experience visiting the cemetery to pay respects to fallen comrades, emphasizing the importance of remembering the sacrifices made by those who fought and died for their country.

Conversation: I went to Super Junior's concert last night . It was fantastic . Really ? Their songs are very popular all round Asia now . I am also a big fan of theirs . Yes , their new album just came out last week . It is number one on the billboard . I really love their dancing . They are all excellent dancers . The lyrics of the new song are beautiful , too . Can you sing ? Sure . I think you can hear the song everywhere you go now . Let's go buy their new album . Want to come with me ? Why not ?
Summaries: The speaker attended Super Junior's concert and enjoyed it. They mentioned that the group's songs are popular throughout Asia, they're a fan, and their new album just debuted at number one on the Billboard chart. The speaker praised the group's dancing skills and beautiful song lyrics. They invited someone to go with them to buy the new album, suggesting its popularity would make it easily accessible everywhere.

Conversation: I am a little nervous about my presentation on Friday . If you would like me to , I could help you with that . Wouldn't that take you away from your project ? I have plenty of time to do this . I promise you it won't be a problem for me . Is there a good time for you to help me ? If we work on this tomorrow night , you could easily be ready by Friday . How about meeting in my office ? That would work out well . Bring any concerns that you might have . Sounds like you'll be able to help me a lot . Don't worry . Everything will go well . I promise !
Summaries: The speaker is nervous about their presentation on Friday and asks for help, offering to reciprocate if needed. They assure that it won't be a problem for them to work on the presentation together, suggesting a meeting in their office tomorrow night to get everything ready by Friday. The tone is reassuring and positive, with promises of success.

Conversation: If you can choose , will you marry a foreigner or a Chinese ? Why ? Did tom pop the question ? Not yet . But I wonder if I can get my parents ’ consent . Let me guess , your parents want you to marry a Chinese man , right ? You are right . It is giving me a real headache . I feel like I ’ m between a rock and a hard place . I used to have the same problem when I was with my ex . Oh , how did you deal with it ? I just let it go and continued dating with my Korean boyfriend . But finally we broke up . Oh , it ’ s a pity . What was the matter ? Simple . We had personality clashes and there were too many cultural differences . Like what ? He hoped to live in the Korean way and asked me to give up working and stay at home to take care of the family . Oh , I see . In their culture women should put family first . Yes , he said it would be better for me and for the whole family . But I simply can not quit working . So that's why it ’ s hard to have a happy marriage with a foreigner . Not really . There are many successful mixed marriage around us .
Summaries: The speaker is considering marrying someone from abroad or China, but is having trouble getting parental consent. They are torn between pleasing their parents' wishes (marrying a Chinese person) and following their own heart's desire (marrying someone else). The speaker shares a past experience with an ex-boyfriend who was Korean, where cultural differences caused friction. They ultimately broke up due to incompatibility. Despite this, the speaker notes that there are many successful mixed marriages around them, suggesting that marrying someone from abroad is not entirely impossible.

Conversation: Where is Tom ? He is in the bedroom and fallen asleep . What ? It ’ s only 9p . m . Now . Why today he went to bed so early ? He ran four miles and came back dead beat . Oh , I see .
Summaries: Tom fell asleep in the bedroom at 9pm, surprising considering it was relatively early. The reason for his early bedtime is that he had just finished running 4 miles and was exhausted.

Conversation: Hi , Ann . Hi . You look excited . What's happening ? I just heard that our school will hold a singing contest in 5 days . And you're planning to enter ? Of course . This is a great chance for me to show off my beautiful voice . Is there a prize ? I heard that the winner gets a Panda Radio . Do you think you have a chance ? A chance ? Not just a chance , I'm a hundred percent certain.Everyone says my voice is beautiful . But you haven't practised all that much . I still have 5 days to practise . It's in the bag ! Don't be too sure . You're still going to need some help . Yeah , maybe .
Summaries: The speaker, Ann, and a friend discuss the upcoming singing contest at their school, which will take place in 5 days. Ann plans to enter the contest to showcase her voice, with the potential prize being a Panda Radio. The friend expresses confidence in Ann's chances of winning, but also advises her not to be too sure, suggesting that she may need help improving her skills within the remaining time frame.

Conversation: I've got to go to bed . Have to work tomorrow . OK . Good night , then . Have a good sleep . Good night . See you tomorrow .
Summaries: The speaker plans to go to bed early as they have work scheduled for the next day. They bid each other goodnight, wishing a good sleep and a safe return in the morning.

Conversation: I wonder if it is possible that we organize a dinner party for all the colleagues in our departments . They are working very hard these days . Maybe it is time for everybody to relax a little . That is a good idea , I love it . What time do you think is convenient ? Well , what about this Thursday evening after we finish the weekly meeting ? Ok , I will inform everybody when they come back from lunch . It has been a long time since we had the department dinner last time . I am sure they don ’ t want to miss it . I hope so . Let me know how many will come . Then I will book the restaurant .
Summaries: The speaker suggests organizing a dinner party for colleagues in their departments, as they are working hard. The idea is well-received and a tentative date is set for Thursday evening after the weekly meeting. The speaker offers to inform everyone and book the restaurant once they have an estimated number of attendees.

Conversation: What day is today ? Today is Thursday . What's the date today ? Today is May first , 2003 . Oh , today's International Labour Day . Is it our working day ? Well , I don't think so .
Summaries: Today, Thursday, May 1st, 2003, is International Labour Day. However, the speaker doesn't think it's a regular working day.

Conversation: Can you take part in our picnic this Saturday ? That would be fine . Where are you going ? We plan to go to a forest in the suburb . There is a beautiful river there . We can do some fishing . Great . And don't forget your fishing tackle . Ok . I like fishing very much .
Summaries: The conversation revolves around a picnic planned for Saturday. The host invites someone to join them, and they agree to participate. The group plans to visit a forest in the suburb, which has a beautiful river where they can do some fishing. The guest expresses enthusiasm for fishing and agrees to bring their own tackle.

Conversation: Daniel , what are you doing here ? Aren't you supposed to be at school now ? The same question to you . Well , we shall make it a secret between us . Deal , Where is Gucci ? She is the cheer-leader . They are required to put on a performance . Look ! Here they come . Oh , look at her . She looks like one is the basketball babies in NBA . I want to be like her . Boy , you've got such a crush on her , haven't you ? Yes , I want to be her boyfriend . Just like in the movie . Are you out of your mind ? She told me she liked my new haircut . Conversation: Good morning . I want to apply for a library card . Give me 10 yuan , your ID card and a photo of you please . But I hear that the card is free . Yes , it is . However, it is clarified that the card itself is free, but a deposit is required, which will be refunded when the card is returned in good condition (no dirt or scratches).

Conversation: What do you think of the plan for the new airport near here ? Perhaps they should give it a second thought . The residents are getting up in arms about it . I think they will .
