Conversation: I'm so glad to meet you . How is everything going on ? Fine . You look prettier than before . Really ? Thank you .
Summaries: The conversation begins with a friendly greeting and inquiry about the person's well-being, followed by a positive assessment of their appearance. The person being addressed expresses gratitude for the compliment.

Conversation: You must be annoyed about your boyfriend ’ s leaving you , huh ? Don ’ t ever mention him . I ’ m getting over it . It ’ s a sad thing . I ’ m ever so sorry ... Are you done ?
Summaries: The speaker is comforting someone who has just gone through a breakup, assuring them that they too can get over their ex. The speaker expresses empathy and apologizes for the situation, but also politely wraps up the conversation by asking if the person is "done" talking about it.

Conversation: Hello , Rebecca , fancy meeting you here ! Hi , Paul . I haven't seen you for a long time . How have you been ? Fine , thank you , and you ? Pretty good . What brings you here ? I came to see my uncle . He lives in the next block .
Summaries: Paul and Rebecca reunite, exchanging brief updates on their well-being. Paul reveals that he's been doing fine and asks about Rebecca's situation. She mentions visiting her uncle who resides nearby.

Conversation: What courses are you going to take next year ? Well , I am certainly going to take chemistry and physics , but I haven't decided on the other subjects yet . I'd like to take English . Why are you going to take english with chemistry and physics ? Because I want to study english literature . but I think chemistry is better for getting a job . Of course it depends on what you are going to do when you leave college . Have you beside what you are going to do when you graduated ? I am going to be a , well , I hope to be a research chemist .
Summaries: The speaker plans to take chemistry and physics as core subjects next year, with English literature being their interest. They believe chemistry will be useful for getting a job, while the other courses are dependent on future career goals. The speaker hopes to become a research chemist after graduation.

Conversation: Hi , chary , are you busy this evening ? sorry , I'm afraid that I've got plans tonight . what are you doing ? I'm going to my parents ' house for my father's birthday . how old is he today ? it's his 50th birthday . well , wish him a happy birthday for me . sure thing . What are your plans for the evening ? I was just thinking of going to a movie tonight . well , if you can wait until tomorrow night , I'll go with you then . sorry , I've got people coming over tomorrow night . sounds like this weekend just isn't going to work out for us . sounds that way . Maybe some other time then ? sure.Hey , I'm sorry , but I've got to get going . yeah , me , too . It's about time I made a move . say hello to your friends for me . likewise . See you later . Bye !
Summaries: The conversation begins with Chary being asked if they're busy this evening, but they have plans. The person asking then shares their own plan to go to their parents' house for their father's 50th birthday. They invite Chary to join them, but Chary declines due to other commitments. The two suggest going out another time, but ultimately decide it won't work out this weekend. They exchange pleasantries and agree to part ways.

Conversation: Good afternoon ! Hi , how are you doing ? Fine , thanks . I am Wang Lin . Glad to meet you , Wang Lin . I am Mary . Is this your first time in Beijing ? Yes . My company has an office here , and I have just been transferred . Here is my phone number . If you need anyone to show you around , call me . Great . I would like that .
Summaries: Wang Lin (from Beijing) meets Mary, who has just been transferred to Beijing by her company. Wang Lin offers to help Mary get settled in Beijing and shows hospitality by giving her his phone number, suggesting she call him if she needs any assistance or guidance around the city.

Conversation: Hey Michelle , jump in quick . It's pouring out there ! Oh , hi Melissa . Are you going to the conference too ? I was planning to pick up Mr . Campbell . Yes , he told me . We need to pick him up at his hotel and then go to the conference . Oh I see , okay . So I heard you got married . Congratulations ! Ah thank you ! I'm very excited . We were going to get married next year , but then we decided to get married on holiday instead . It was wonderful . That sounds so romantic ! Jack and I were hoping to get married in Europe next year , but we had to postpone our plans . We just don't have the money ! I know what you mean . I think Shanghai is getting more and more expensive , don't you ? I sure do . In my opinion , it's actually becoming more expensive than back home . Definitely . Oh , there's Mr . Campbell . Driver , can you stop here please ?
Summaries: Michelle and Melissa discuss their plans to pick up Mr. Campbell at his hotel and attend a conference. They also chat about their personal lives, with Michelle having recently gotten married on holiday after originally planning to get married next year. Melissa expresses her understanding, mentioning that she and her fiancé Jack are having to postpone their wedding plans due to financial constraints. The conversation also touches on the rising cost of living in Shanghai.

Conversation: What's that , a new video game ? Nope ! It's the latest generation of PAD ! You won't believe what it can do . For instance ? It has a built-in camera unit that takes digital color stills . It also plays MP3 files , which I can save on media cards and then transfer to the hard drive of my computer . Wow ! Anything else ? This one comes with its own folding keyboard . It has a pre-installed handwriting recognition program . I can use the stylus to write on the screen . What if I want to use CD-ROMs or floppies ? Just plug in a peripheral CD or floppy drive and you're ready to go !
Summaries: The latest generation of Personal Digital Assistant (PAD) is announced, featuring advanced capabilities. Key highlights include: built-in digital camera for color stills; MP3 file playback with media card storage; a folding keyboard; pre-installed handwriting recognition program; and compatibility with external CD-ROM or floppy drives through peripherals.

Conversation: Hey , what's up ? Oh , nothing . What were you writing ? ( Laugh ) All right . You caught me in the act . I finally worked up the nerve to ask Diana out . I was just writing a note to put on her desk . You mean you're going to ask her out in a note ? You big chicken ! I admit it . I'm a wuss . I just can't do it in person . But , you work with her everyday . That's different . When I'm working , I'm in a different frame of mind . But , when I even think about asking her out , I get tongue-tied . At least in a note , I can get the words out without turning beet red . You've dated a lot . What's so different about Diana ? Well , for one thing , she's gorgeous . She's so upbeat and sweet . Who doesn't like her ? Oh , I don't know . All I do know is that I think we have great chemistry together . But , what if I'm wrong . Maybe she's just been nice to me out of courtesy and doesn't think of me that way . Oh ... forget it . This was a bad idea . Well , I guess you don't want this note , then . What note ? I was looking for you to deliver this note from Diana . She wants to know if you want to go to the office party with her tomorrow night . You're kidding ! I can't believe you've been standing this entire time and didn't say anything . Sorry . What can I say ? Now , do you want the note or what ? Yeah , I want the note . Have a great time tomorrow night . Thanks . I plan on it .
Summaries: A person is nervous about asking their coworker, Diana, out and considers writing her a note instead. They admit to being shy and unable to ask her in person. A friend who has dated multiple people offers words of encouragement, noting that Diana is "gorgeous" and "upbeat." The person ultimately decides to take the plunge and asks their friend to deliver a note from Diana, which invites them to an office party.

Conversation: So , what happened ? He never came . He stood you up . I wouldn ’ t exactly characterize it in that way . I think something happened . Something terrible and unexpected that made it impossible for him to ... what if he showed up , took one look at me and left ? Not possible . Maybe , there was a subway accident . Absolutely . A train got trapped underground with him inside . And no phone . And you know , how those express trains create suction .
Summaries: A person stood someone up, but it's unclear if it was intentional. The situation is described as unexpected and terrible, making it impossible for the person to show up. A hypothetical scenario is presented where the person might have been involved in a subway accident, causing them to be trapped underground with no phone signal.

Conversation: Mary , how was your date with john ? It's OK . It seems we have a lot in common . Oh , really ? That is great news . What does he look like ? He is tall and slim , fair-haired . Sounds like he is pretty cute . What do you think of him ? He is a nice guy and very considerate . I am impressed with how smart he is and he has a great sense of humor . Oh , it's love at first sight . When will you see each other again ? He didn't say , but he said he would call me . Maybe he is busy with his work . Just wait and try not to think about it too much ! Oh , David . Stop it ! I am a bit nervous ! What should I do if he doesn't call me ? Come on , Mary , you're a total catch . I bet he will call you . Don't worry . Thank you , David . You're always so encouraging . That's what friends are for .
Summaries: Mary had a date with John, who seems to be a great match. They share common interests and John is tall, slim, fair-haired, and has a great sense of humor. Mary is impressed with his intelligence and considerate nature, leading her to think that it might be "love at first sight". The conversation focuses on the positive aspects of their date, with David (apparently a friend) offering words of encouragement and reassurance that John will likely call Mary again.

Conversation: I feel terrible , but I've just broken your ashtray . It's nothing to get upset about . I don't know what to say . I'd like to replace it . No . It's out of the question .
Summaries: A person has accidentally broken something belonging to someone else (an ashtray), feels terrible, and wants to make it right by replacing it. The owner refuses, deeming it "nothing to get upset about."

Conversation: I'm so angry at Bob for buying a new bike . What's the big deal ?
Summaries: You're upset with Bob for purchasing a new bike, which seems like an innocuous decision. However, there might be underlying reasons or context that are not immediately apparent, making it important to explore further to understand your anger and its root cause.

Conversation: The hotel is full tonight . we will need to find a new place to stay . Maybe it's just a blessing in disguise . I've been wanting to try a new place anyway .
Summaries: The hotel is fully booked, forcing the speaker and others to look for alternative accommodations. However, this unexpected twist might actually be an opportunity to explore a new option that they had been considering trying out anyway.

Conversation: Do you know much about computers ? Not a great deal . I've just been reading an article about them.they ' ll be used for all sorts of things now . For accounting system and things like that , you mean ? Yes , but they are used for other things , too.Do you remember when we went to buy a ticket for the flight to Paris . Yes ? The man asked where we want to go , then he type out the information on the form and waited for a reply . A few moment later , he gave us two tickets . Of course , his machine must have been connected to a computer . That's right .
Summaries: The speaker lacks knowledge about computers but has read an article highlighting their various uses. They recall a recent experience buying airline tickets in which the ticket agent used a computer system to process and print out the tickets. The implication is that computers are being increasingly integrated into everyday life for tasks beyond accounting systems, such as travel booking.

Conversation: How happy you are ! Next Monday is your wedding day . Congratulations ! Thank you ! Fred is really a good guy . And he loves you so much . Yeah . I'm lucky to be his wife . He's after your own heart , it is important . So he will make a perfect husband . Make sure you will be here next Monday . I promise !
Summaries: The conversation appears to be about an upcoming wedding, with the speaker expressing happiness and gratitude. They mention that Fred is a good guy who loves the intended bride dearly, making him a perfect match for her. The speaker also promises that the bride will be present at the wedding next Monday. Overall, the tone is positive and celebratory, congratulating the couple on their upcoming union.

Conversation: Many happy returns of the day , darling ? Thank you very much . And here is your birthday present . A gold watch ! Do you like it ? I love it ! Darling , you ’ re kind .
Summaries: The speaker expresses gratitude and affection, wishing someone a "many happy returns of the day" on their birthday. They gift a gold watch, inquiring if the person likes it, and themselves exclaiming that they love it, indicating strong emotions. The speaker also calls the recipient "kind", highlighting their appreciation for the person's nature.

Conversation: I didn't expect to see you at this hour . You must have goofed off again . Goofed off ? Maybe , but I'm not a clock-watcher . I finished doing what I should do and then knock off an hour earlier . You'll be sorry if the boss finds it out . He may probably give you the bag . I'm sure of what I'm doing .
Summaries: The speaker is surprised to see someone at an unusual hour, implying that they were expecting them to be working later. The person being spoken to claims they took a break early and aren't concerned about their boss's reaction, warning that if found out, they might receive disciplinary action (possibly getting "the bag").

Conversation: Hi Jane , you look great . You too . Have you lost some weight ? Yes , I took off 4 kilos . I am glad you notice it . Not some crazy diet fat I hope . No no , I just changed my eating habits . I eat a balance meal . and I eat less than before . Good for you , keep it up .
Summaries: The conversation starts with a compliment on Jane's appearance, followed by a discussion about her weight loss. She has lost 4 kilos and is glad someone noticed. When asked if she was following a crazy diet, she clarifies that it's just a matter of eating balanced meals and reducing portion sizes. The other person encourages her to keep up the good work.

Conversation: On balance , dress designing appeals to me most . Yes , it's to my liking , too . Say , how would you like to be a dress designer ? It's my dream .
Summaries: The speaker finds dressing design appealing and enjoyable, and thinks it aligns with their personal taste. They express interest in pursuing a career as a dress designer, making it their dream job.

Summaries: The conversation starts with casual greetings between Sue, Andrew, and others. Andrew shares that his boss has been giving him extra work, making him very busy. He mentions he's also training new employees, which adds to his workload.

Conversation: OK , that ’ s fine . Bye . What happened ? That ’ s it , my lease is up . I have to move . What ? Why ? Can ’ t you renew it ? The owner apparently is selling this place to make way for the construction of a parking lot Well , I can help you pack . We should start looking for a new place for you ASAP . I think I might move in with my parents for a couple of months until I can find something . You know how hard it is to find a decent place around here . I ’ m gonna have to put most of my stuff in storage for a while . Well , let me know if there ’ s anything I can do to help out . Actually , would you mind looking after my pet tarantula and snake for a couple of weeks ? Hehe .. sure
Summaries: The person's lease has expired, and they have to move because the owner is selling the property to make way for a parking lot construction. They may need to put most of their belongings in storage. Their friend offers to help pack and also agrees to look after their pet tarantula and snake for a couple of weeks.

Conversation: Which social problem do you think the government needs to concentrate on most ? I think housing is a big problem . There are thousands of homeless people on the streets . How would you solve the problem ? I have a good idea to solve it . The government could provide some money for homeless people to build their own homes . It would probably be very expensive . I think the government can afford it . Besides , there are many advantages . Homeless people would find it easier to get jobs if they had an address . They would learn some useful skill for finding jobs in the construction industry or home improvement . It ’ s not a bad idea . I think education is the biggest problem at the moment . Schools don ’ t seem to have enough money to educate kids properly . If we are to invest more money to education , we will need to raise taxes . That wouldn ’ t be popular with voters . Most voters what everything bout ways . They want the government to pay for lots of things , but without increasing taxes . The government should show that it is using money efficiently . Sometimes you hear about how the government has wasted money on a project . Yes . The government has limited funds and must show that it is using the money responsibly .
Summaries: housing and education. They propose providing funding for homeless individuals to build their own homes, which would have numerous benefits such as improving job prospects and teaching valuable skills. The second concern is education, where schools lack sufficient funds, leading to a proposal to invest more in education by raising taxes. However, the speaker recognizes that this might not be popular with voters and suggests the government must demonstrate responsible use of limited funds to justify any increases in spending.

Conversation: The sun is shining . But there're some mare's tails . That's the sign of wind . Oh , really , I thought it was a sign of rain .
Summaries: A person observes that the sun is shining, but notices "mare's tails" (cirrus clouds) in the sky. This is mistakenly interpreted as a sign of rain, whereas mare's tails are actually an indicator of wind.

Conversation: Hello , Joanna . You are looking very charming in the new dress . Thanks . Does it suit me ? Yes , it suits you very well . It certainly is unique . I don ’ t think I ’ Ve seen anything like it before . I know . That ’ s why I bought it . I hate wearing the same styles like everybody else is wearing . And the necklace , it matches your dress marvelously . It ’ s very nice of you to say so . I should say you are glamorous yourself , as a matter of fact . Thank you for saying so .
Summaries: Joanna receives compliments on her new dress and jewelry, which she chose because they're unique and different from what others wear. She appreciates the praise and returns the compliment to the other person, acknowledging their own glamorous appearance.

Conversation: Welcome back ! How was your vacation ? It was fantastic , but I'm glad to be back ! Being a tourist is really tiring ! Where did you end up going ? Because it's off-season , we got a really good package deal to Paris , so we went there . I've always wanted to go to Paris . The Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous tourist attractions in the world ! Did you go to the top ? That was the first thing we did . I have a few pictures . Do you want to see them ? Sure . What's this one a picture of ? Oh , that's a picture of me on our fourth day of travelling . I'm standing next to a famous foundation in the centre of the city . You don't look very happy in that picture . No , by that time , I was sick of sightseeing . I had had enough of art galleries , cathedrals , fountains , statues , and palaces ! So what did you do ? We spent that afternoon walking around a flea market . We had a few coffees , watched a movie , and went for a swim in the pool at the hotel . My travel agent always reminds me to plan a day of relaxing for every 3 days of sightseeing . Did you go to the Louvre ? Of course ! You can't go to Paris without going to their famous art gallery ! I was surprised by how small the Mona Lisa was though . That's what everyone says ! I can't wait to see it for myself some day .
Summaries: The speaker returned from their vacation in Paris, where they spent 4 days sightseeing. They took advantage of an off-season package deal and explored famous attractions like the Eiffel Tower. While they enjoyed the initial excitement, they grew tired by the fourth day and opted for a relaxing afternoon at a flea market. The trip also included visits to art galleries, including the Louvre, where they were surprised by the small size of the Mona Lisa.

Conversation: Your ring is very beautiful . Thank you . It has been handed down in my family for three generations . Oh , it is precious . It surely is .
Summaries: The speaker thanks someone for complimenting their ring, which has significant sentimental value as it's been passed down through three generations of their family. They emphasize its importance and beauty, acknowledging that it holds a special place in their heart.

Conversation: Our major is from a bigger city . He ’ s doing fine . A new broom sweeps clean . He brings with him some talented people from his former city . I think we ’ ll benefit a lot .
Summaries: A colleague from a larger city has joined their team, bringing with him talent and expertise. This fresh perspective is expected to bring significant benefits to the group.

Conversation: Hey , where's Cindy ? She told me that she's got tennis practice today . You're Mary , right ? How did you know ? Cindy told me about you in our gym class . I see . Do you live in this neighborhood , too ? My house is next door to yours . Oh , Cindy did mention you before . You're Alexander Newman . Just call me Alex . Alex and Alexander are the same thing .
Summaries: Cindy was supposed to have tennis practice, but her whereabouts were unknown. Mary (Alex) confirmed knowing Cindy through their gym class. They discovered they lived next door to each other, with Alex being an alias for Alexander Newman.

Conversation: What's the score ? The Ukraine team took the lead by 3 to 1 at the end of the first half . The Russian team needs to tie the Ukraine to get the pass for the final . It doesn't seem to be so easy .
Summaries: Ukraine leads Russia 3-1 at halftime in their match, with Russia needing to tie to advance to the final. The situation seems challenging for Russia.

Conversation: I hear that there is a festival called Duanwu in China . Yes . It is also called Dragon Boat Festival . Why are you celebrating this festival ? We celebrate it to commemorate a great patriotic poet of China — Qu Yuan . What do you do on that day ? We'll have rice dumplings . What's more , there are also dragon boat matches in some places of southern China . I see .
Summaries: The Dragon Boat Festival (also known as Duanwu) is celebrated in China to commemorate Qu Yuan, a great patriotic poet. On this day, people typically eat rice dumplings and participate in dragon boat matches in some southern regions of China.

Conversation: Hey , there's Leo . I wonder why he's walking arm in arm with that young woman . It's as plain as the nose on your face . They're dating each other . You're pulling my leg ! She must be thirty years younger than Leo . Talk about robbing the cradle ! Well , you can bet this relationship's going to be a flash in the pan . It must have been love at first sight because I know he didn't have a girlfriend last week . I think you are absolutely right . Actually , my father proposed to my mother after knowing her only two weeks . They got married a month later .
Summaries: The speaker wonders why Leo, an older man, is walking with a significantly younger woman and concludes they're dating. The speaker thinks it's unlikely to last due to their age difference. However, another person shares a personal anecdote about their father proposing to their mother just two weeks after meeting her, followed by a quick marriage, suggesting that relationships can be unpredictable and not always follow traditional expectations.

Conversation: How many credits are you taking this semester ? I have to have at least eighteen to keep my scholarships and grant . But so far , I only have fifteen . What's the matter , are the classes you want full ? Yes . And now I'm down to either taking a class I'm not going to need or considering a double major . If you were to take on a double major , what would be your first choice ? I think with International Business a language would be appropriate . Have you even thought that far ahead ? I mean what country would you like to do business with ? As a matter of fact , I would like to work in South America . So some Latin language like Spanish or Portuguese would work .
Summaries: The conversation revolves around taking credits for the semester, with one person having 15 out of the required 18 to keep their scholarships and grants. They're considering taking an extra class or double majoring, specifically in International Business with a focus on a Latin American country like South America, where they would use Spanish or Portuguese.

Conversation: What part did you get in the play this time ? I got a character part — some old lady who shows up in a few scenes . I wish I had a character part . Those are my favorite . Are you kidding ? You got the leading role . I know , but I've done that so Ay times . It's getting old . The leading guy is always the same macho A . I would trade you if I could but I don't think I'd be a very convincing macho A . Next time . You are going to love your part . I've seen the script . I do a good old lady . I wouldn't mind being the damsel in distress once in a while .
Summaries: The speaker is discussing their roles in a play with someone who got the leading role. They express envy at getting a character part, feeling it's more exciting than always playing the leading guy. The other person reassures them that they'll "love" their part and has seen the script, doing a good job as an old lady.

Conversation: Are you free on Friday evening because we were wondering if you would like to come round for dinner ? Oh , thank you very much . I ’ Ve got a lot going on the next couple of weeks . Why don ’ t I call you later ? Okay , that ’ s fine .
Summaries: The speaker invites someone to dinner on Friday evening and the person expresses gratitude but has to decline due to being busy. They suggest alternative times, but are unsure as they have a lot going on in the next couple of weeks.

Conversation: Which season do you like best ? I like spring best . It is neither too cold nor too hot . Freezing days make me lazy and stuffy days make me lazier . How about you ? I prefer summer , especially the summer evenings . When the sun comes down , it is so nice to take a walk and breathe . After a rain shower , the smell of the air is refreshing . It is also a best reason for ice-cream . How do you get through the stuffy daytime ? Well , I have to hide in the air-conditioned rooms . Anyway , it is all worth , just think about the cool evening time .
Summaries: The conversation revolves around the best season, with one person preferring spring (neither too cold nor hot) and the other liking summer. The summer enthusiast enjoys the refreshing air after a rain shower and the pleasant evenings perfect for walks. However, they also face the challenge of stuffy daytime, which is mitigated by hiding in air-conditioned rooms. Despite the difficulties, the speaker finds it all worth it due to the lovely evening times.

Conversation: Great party , isn't it ? Yeah , really , jane and ted always have great parties . This is my first , I only met jane last week . she and I teach at the same school . Oh , so you're a teacher . Yeah , history , what about you ? I'm in the car business . Salesman ? Yes , that's right . Oh , I see , by the way , my name's Mary . Nice to meet you , I'm jim taylor .

Conversation: Remember that old man who used to beg for money on the street across from our house ? Yeah . Whatever became of him ? He got a job and now he owns a small grocery in town . That's great . We should visit him some time .
Summaries: An elderly man previously known for begging for money on the street was recently found to have secured employment and now owns a small grocery store in town.

Conversation: Sorry . I've got to run . OK . See you .
Summaries: The speaker is apologizing and abruptly ending the conversation, saying they have to go and will see the other person soon.

Conversation: Hello , this is the International Student Office . My name is Leah . How may I help you ? I'd like to speak to the Ms . Collins , please . Ok . Can I ask who is calling , please ? This is Nathaniel Brown . And what is your call regarding ? I'd like to talk to her about my accommodation situation . Ok , I'll try and put you through . Please hold . Ok . ... Sorry , her line is busy at the moment . Can I take a message ? Sure . Can you have her call me back on my cell phone number ? Ok . What's your number ? It's 0-7- 7-8- 7-3- 6-7- 6-8- 8 . Let me repeat that back to you . That's zero , double seven , eight , seven , three , six , seven , double six , double eight . No , there's no double six at the end of the number . It's just zero , double seven , eight , seven , three , six , seven , six , double eight . I got it . When should I have her call you back ? Anytime before 6 pm tonight . Ok , Nathaniel . I'll have Ms . Collins call you back sometime tonight before 6 pm . Thank you ! Bye ! bye !
Summaries: Nathaniel Brown calls the International Student Office to speak with Ms. Collins about his accommodation situation. The representative, Leah, takes the message when Ms. Collins' line is busy. Nathaniel provides his cell phone number for her to call back: 0777387688 (repeated twice to ensure accuracy). He requests a callback anytime before 6 pm that evening.

Conversation: Dan , Dan , dude . You have to come over to my house right now ! Is everything OK ? Just get over here ! Come in ! Quickly ! So , since when is your house a bank ? What do you mean ? I mean , what ’ s up with the locks and iron bars on your windows . Security , Dan , security ! You can never be too safe you know ! A lot of sickos out there . Just the other day they caught that peeping tom red handed ! Had a high power telescope and binoculars by his window . What ’ s the matter with you ? Why are you acting all paranoid ? Paranoid ? I ’ m not paranoid ! I ’ m cautious ! You see Dan , we have to be on guard at all time ! People just invade your privacy as if they knew you ! Telemarketers , solicitors , even your bank ! They have way too much information ! I like to keep everything on a need to know basis . OK , well , what did you want to see me about ? You are being watched ! Be careful Dan ! Be careful !
Summaries: The conversation starts with an urgent request from the speaker to Dan, followed by a series of questions and concerns about the speaker's house being heavily secured. The speaker reveals that they have installed locks and iron bars on their windows due to paranoia about security and privacy threats, citing examples such as peeping toms and telemarketers. They express a sense of caution, believing that people need to be vigilant in protecting their personal information. The conversation ends with the speaker warning Dan to "be careful" and emphasizing the importance of being aware of potential surveillance.

Conversation: You didn't ring me last night.You said you would . I'm sorry to have made you disappointed . That's all right . But why were you so rude to me at lunch . Was I ? Sorry , I didn'y mean to be . I do apologize . And why are you yarning now ? Are you bored ? Forgive me darling . I'm very tired .
Summaries: The conversation appears to revolve around a lack of phone call, followed by hurt feelings and apologies on both sides. The speaker is upset that the other person didn't ring them as planned, leading to disappointment. The other person responds with an apology and explanations for their behavior at lunch, which was perceived as rude. The conversation then shifts to the present moment, with the speaker expressing tiredness and seeking forgiveness.

Conversation: Hey ! What's up ? Hi , John ! I haven't seen you for ages . Yeah , I've been out of town . So how have you been ? Great ! Work is really busy now , but it's fun .
Summaries: The conversation starts with a casual greeting and introduction. The speaker mentions they've been out of town, and the person they're talking to (John) shares that their work has been busy lately, but enjoyable.

Conversation: Hey , let's go to the night market after work tonight . That's a good idea . I haven't been in a while and I need to get a new backpack . The old one is hanging on by a thread ! That reminds me I should buy some new socks to go hiking this weekend .

We live on the fourth floor . It ’ s a small world ! May I know your name , miss ? I ’ m Chen Ming . How do you do , Miss Chen ? I ’ m Song Mei . I ’ m glad to meet you , Mr . Song . Are you going to your office now , Miss Chen ? No , I ’ m going to the airport to meet some friends from Beijing .
Summaries: Chen Ming and Song Mei have an unexpected encounter when she returns his umbrella. They discover they live in the same building, just two floors apart, and have recently moved in. Chen Ming learns that Song Mei is heading to the airport to meet friends from Beijing, while Song Mei has no office plans.

Conversation: I have a sweet tooth . I can not help but think about having something sweet between meals . A new candy shop just opened around the corner last week . I would like to buy some candies . Since there are so many people , I think they must have delicious candy . Look at the candy bar over there . It is so colorful and tasty . They have lollypops , chocolate drops , fruit candy , mints , pearbrittles and toffee . They are in different colors and flavors . I want to get a big bag and buy a little of everything . Me too . I finally understand why a small shop like this can always befilmed with dozens of people . To be honest , I care only about whether I can have some delicious candy eat . I couldn't care less about whether the shop is popular or not . You are a candy terminator . Be careful or you'll get a lot of cavities . That is true . Speaking of cavities , I am starting to feel something is wrong with my teeth now . Let's get more strawberry chocolate drops before we go home . You really can't live without candy .
Summaries: The speaker has a sweet tooth and can't help but crave sweets between meals. They're attracted to a new candy shop that just opened around the corner, which is always crowded with people. Despite the crowds, they want to buy some candies, thinking that if it's popular, it must be good. The shop offers a variety of colorful and tasty treats, including lollipops, chocolate drops, fruit candy, mints, peanut brittle, and toffee. The speaker wants to get a big bag with a little bit of everything and is willing to ignore the potential consequences for their teeth health.

Conversation: What would you say if I told you I was going to quit school ? I ’ d say , think twice about it . Well , you are not going to quit school , are you ? I don't know . I failed my exam . What did you get ? A B plus . That's not bad . But I should have aced it . I mean I finished the paper so quickly , thinking it's a piece of cake . But when I knew my result , I was like what ? That can't be true ! Listen , John . I understand that you are such an excellent student and I know you must have lots of stress , but you really want to give up ? No , I don't . I just don't know how to handle this . This is my first time , you know . I know . Don't worry . Do you know what you should do ? What ? You need to blow off some steam . The world is not on your shoulder . How ? Forget about school and exams . Come over to my house and have fun . I have some really good DVDs . Thanks . But I really don't feel like watching movies tonight . I have to get an early start in the morning . Then go to bed and have a good sleep . I guess that's what I need . Thanks . You're being a really good friend . Of course I am . Well , pleasant dreams ! Thanks , bye .
Summaries: The speaker (John) finds out their friend has failed an exam and is considering quitting school. John advises his friend to think twice about it and not give up easily. The friend expresses frustration and stress due to the failure, but John reassures him that he can handle it and suggests blowing off some steam by having fun and forgetting about school for a while.

Conversation: Do you have a family tradition at Christmas time ? We have so Ay ! But my favorite happens at Christmas Eve . What is it ? Conversation: Karen , do you have a minute ? I'd like to ask you about something . Sure . What is it ? I think you can give me some advice.You have worked here longer , and I just want to know what you think . I'm glad to help you . But what is it you want to ask about ? I am worried about the meeting this morning . Why ? I think the meeting went well . Really ? Yes . But what are you worried about ? I'm afraid I was too rude . Rude ? You weren't rude at all , Annie . Why do you think you were rude ? Well , I maybe talked to Mr . Drummond too directly . I thought I maybe said too much . I don't want him to be angry . I understand . But really you weren't rude at all.You said what you thought . I think he appreciates that . Really ? Yes . But I am new here , and I'm not sure he is used to that . You mean because you are a woman ? Yes . And he is the president of the company . Listen , Annie . You shouldn't worry about Mr . Drummond.He is a very good man to work for . He is not sexist at all.He appreciates people for their ideas.And he is willing to take suggestions from men or women . I am very happy to hear that , Karen.It ' s good to know I'm working in such a company . I agree with you on that , Annie . I've worked for Derek Drummond for nine years now . I feel he appreciates his employees for their work , not their gender . I would never change jobs . Good . Thank you for telling me this . Any time . If you have a good idea , don't be afraid to speak up.This is a company that appreciates initiative .
Summaries: Annie is worried about a meeting she had with her boss, Mr. Drummond, and thinks she may have come across as rude or too direct. Karen, who has worked for the company longer, reassures Annie that she wasn't rude at all and that Mr. Drummond appreciates people's ideas and is willing to take suggestions from both men and women. Karen shares her positive experience working with Mr. Drummond, saying he values his employees' work and doesn't discriminate based on gender. She encourages Annie to speak up with her ideas, as the company appreciates initiative.

Conversation: I really admire you , Diana . why , Jerry ? Your words just came out of the blue . you are really happy and able to achieve high scores at school . I work very hard and that's it , you know , practice makes perfect . isn't there anything else ? I have no idea . you must have a high IQ score . well , Jerry , let me tell you a secret . go ahead . my IQ score is slightly above average . seriously ? But you are such a genius . maybe I've got a higher EQ . I'm not sure . well , perhaps you're right . Sometimes EQ matters more than IQ . you can say that again , Jerry . And I'm sure you're high in both of them . With a little more time cracking the books , you can also get high marks . oh , thank you . I'm going to the library , are you coming ? let's go !
Summaries: Diana admires Jerry for his happiness and academic achievements. She attributes this to his hard work and high IQ score, but Jerry reveals that his IQ score is only slightly above average. He suggests that Emotional Intelligence (EQ) may be more important than IQ, and Diana agrees. Jerry encourages her to spend more time studying, implying she can improve her grades with effort. The conversation ends with an invitation to visit the library together.

Conversation: Hey Sarah . Why are you limping ? Oh . Hi Matt . I went snowboarding yesterday and my whole body aches . Was it your first time ? Yeah . And I never want to go again . I remember the first time I went . My back was sore , I couldn't sit down because it hurt my butt , and my legs would cramp if I walked too fast . That's exactly how I feel now . It's only like that the first couple of times . Ha . There won't be a next time . You gotta give it a chance . It's fun after awhile . I'll think about it after I start feeling better . Right now , I don't even want to hear the word snowboarding .
Summaries: Sarah and Matt discuss Sarah's soreness from her first experience snowboarding, which left her body aching. She recounts her initial struggles with back pain, numbness in her butt, and leg cramps. Despite Matt's encouragement to give it another try, saying it gets better after the initial few times, Sarah is adamant that there won't be a next time, at least not until she recovers from her current discomfort.

Conversation: Hi Mark . Oh , hi Stacy . How was your summer vacation ? I worked over the summer at a restaurant . Have to make tuition money , right ? What did you do ? I took summer school . She worked at a startup company as an intern and since the business did well , they asked her if she wanted to work full time . Wow . She's so lucky . She doesn't have a degree and she already has a job . It sounds good now , but I'm traditional . I want the degree , so I wouldn't have accepted the offer . Do you know how much they are paying her ? I don't know . But I bet it must have been a good offer , or she wouldn't have accepted it .

Mark worked at a restaurant to earn tuition money, while Stacy took summer school to catch up on credits he withdrew from last year. Conversation: What do you think of the way people use and treat animals ? I think most people treat animals well , but we are often cruel to animals . When we raise animals for food , the conditions they live in are often poor . Perhaps people should stop eating animals . We could grow more crops . What would you do with all the animals ? You couldn ’ t just let them go . Besides , some people would still hunt them . Meat has become an integral part of our diet . We could provide them with better conditions anyway . We should certainly try to improve the conditions at zoos . We should try to recreate the natural conditions as much as possible . That ’ s true . I think zoo are a good idea , because they allow people to get close to animals . I think it ’ s good for kids to see wild animals . I agree . I ’ m an adult and I love going to the zoo . I don ’ t like animals experiments though . I believe that we can do tests in other ways . I read that the number of animals being used in experiments is falling dramatically as new techniques are being introduced . That ’ s good news . The good thing is that most people treat their pets well . Sometimes you read about people who have been cruel to pets or other animals , but those stories are rare . Have you every given money to any of the charities that take care of animals . Yes , I have . They do an excellent job .
Summaries: The conversation discusses human treatment and use of animals. While acknowledging some cruelty, the speaker believes most people treat animals well, but notes poor conditions in animal farms and zoos. The suggestion to stop eating meat is raised, but concerns about what to do with existing animals are expressed. Improving zoo conditions and reducing animal experimentation are seen as positive steps. The conversation highlights the importance of treating pets well, and some individuals have given money to charities that care for animals.

Conversation: Hi , long time no see . How have you been ? Oh , I've been fine , but I'm having some trouble with my son . Tell me all about it . Summaries: China is the world's most populous country with a population of 1.3 billion, spanning an area similar to Canada and the US. The conversation highlights five cities - Lhasa, Urumqi, Harbin, Shanghai, and Hong Kong - each famous for something: Beijing is the capital, while other notable cities include Chengdu, Dalian, Wuhan, Tianjin, Shenyang, Chongqing, Guangzhou, and Hong Kong.

Yes , someone give me a pamphlet introducing the restaurant and its business hours when I passed by this morning.So , let ’ s have a try . My treat . Great , I like the idea of trying some new food . Good for you . Today we have more chances to try some new food because there are now many new form restaurants in our city coming from places all over the world . Also some traditional Chinese food , like noodles and dumpling are marketed in modern ways with improved food quality . I heard this year , the government has imposed very stringent inspection on the hygiene conditions restaurants and suppliers of food are also under tighter control . For sure all the customers will benefit from this .
Summaries: The speakers discuss a new Mexican restaurant on their street, which was previously under construction but now appears to be open. One speaker has a pamphlet with business hours and offers to treat the other for lunch. The conversation also touches on the city's growing food scene, with many new international restaurants and modern takes on traditional Chinese cuisine like noodles and dumplings. The speakers note that recent government measures have improved hygiene standards in restaurants and food suppliers, benefiting customers.

Conversation: You were right . It's raining again . I told you so .
Summaries: The speaker is gloating about being correct that it's raining again, and is triumphantly saying "I told you so" to someone else who apparently doubted their prediction.

Conversation: Hi . What's up ? Nothing much . What's new with you ? Not too much . I've been pretty busy . Me too . Seems like all I do is eat and sleep . Gotta go . Call me tonight . Okay . Check you later .
Summaries: The conversation appears to be a casual chat between two individuals. They exchange brief updates about their daily lives, mentioning that they've both been busy and not doing much of anything exciting. They agree that it's all about eating and sleeping for them lately. The conversation wraps up with the parties agreeing to catch up later, with one person suggesting a call tonight.

Conversation: What's all this noise about ? They're discussing whether they should replace Miss Smith , the Music teacher . Why ? Because she's not responsible enough .
Summaries: The topic of discussion revolves around replacing Miss Smith, the music teacher, due to concerns over her level of responsibility. This decision is being considered because some individuals believe that she does not meet expectations in this regard.

Conversation: How many people are there in your family ? My immediate family is quite small . It ’ s just my older step-brother , my mom , my step-dad and me . how about you ? I have a large family . I have three older sisters , my twin sister , a younger brother , and parents . I didn ’ t know you were a twin ! Are you identical or fraternal ? We ’ re identical . I mean , we look exactly the same , but we are complete opposites when it comes to everything else . Interesting . It must be great having a twin sister . Are you best friends , too ? We used to be really close , but that all changed once she moved to Shanghai . How about your family ? You didn ’ t mention to your biological father . I don ’ t know much about him . He died when I was just a baby . Even though I don ’ t have a blood relationship with my step-father and step-brother , I consider them to be my real family . What about your step-brother ’ s mother ? Does he keep in touch with her ? No , she also died when my step-brother was little . My mother and my step-father met each other shortly after my father died and became good friends . They ended up getting married a few years later . Sounds like it was meant to be .
Summaries: The speaker talks about their family size, saying they have a small immediate family with 4 members. The other person shares that they have a large family with 7 members, including twin sisters who are identical but opposite in many ways. Despite being close initially, the twins drifted apart after one moved to Shanghai. Both speakers share information about their biological fathers (one passed away at birth, and the other died when the speaker was young). They also discuss their step-families, with both considering their step-relatives as part of their real family.

Conversation: It's awfully quiet around here . Yeah . There's nobody in sight . I have a feeling that we're not supposed to be in here . I think you're right . Let's go .
Summaries: The speaker is expressing unease and suspicion about their surroundings, feeling like they shouldn't be there. They're agreeing with someone else that it's time to leave, possibly due to a sense of being watched or an unknown presence.

Summaries: A person named Mike is planning to travel across the country with a self-driving car. The speaker is impressed by Mike's endeavor and wants to join him, thinking it's a popular idea these days.

Conversation: Where are you going ? I'm going to Bill's house . What are you going to do there ? I'm going to help him . What's he doing ? He's fixing his roof .
Summaries: Person A and Person B discuss their plans. Person A is going to Bill's house, where they will help him fix his roof.

Conversation: Are you going to the movie theater with me tonight ? Is there anything good playing ? Titanic is playing tonight . It's a blockbuster . Really ? I want to go , too . OK , let's meet at the movie theater entrance tonight . Don ’ t be late . No problem . ( After watching the movie . ) Are you crying ? I get a lump in my throat whenever I see a tragic movie . Tragic movie ? I think it's a love story . But their love is touching ! Ah , you're just too emotional . I am not !
Summaries: The conversation starts with someone asking to go to the movie theater and inquires about what's playing. The other person suggests watching "Titanic", which they think is a blockbuster. They agree to meet at the entrance that night. After watching the movie, one of them becomes emotional, crying, while the other thinks it's a love story but acknowledges its touching portrayal of tragic events.

Conversation: Many people play sports in China , don't they ? Yes . Table tennis is probably the most popular . I expect all Chinese can play table tennis . Most anyway . Do you like playing table tennis ? Yes , I like . But I can't play it well . Are indoor sports popular ? Basketball and swimming are very popular . Really ? I like playing basketball , too . We can play together if you are free . That's great .

The speaker shares their own interest and enthusiasm for table tennis, but notes that they don't play well. Indoor sports are also touched upon, with basketball and swimming being mentioned as very popular. The speaker expresses a shared interest in playing basketball together, depending on availability.

Conversation: I couldn't look at you , and say you aren't beautiful ! You are pretending ! No , Miss Anna , you must let me say how lovely you are ! What's wrong with that ? It's wrong because---it isn't true . You know that everybody notices how beautiful you are , don't you ? Well , no-that is , I've heard Linda say they do , but ... Thank you . But please don't speak to me again . Oh , Miss Anna ! That's too hard ! I won't be here long .
Summaries: A student is hesitant to compliment Miss Anna on her beauty, feeling it's not true and others might also think so. Despite being encouraged to do so, they refuse, feeling it's wrong to flatter someone who doesn't actually deserve it. The student eventually gives in, but then asks Miss Anna not to speak to them again because they won't be there for long.

Conversation: Both our countries are quite small . How would you describe the landscape in your country ? My country is well know for being very flat . There are some hills in the southeast of the country . Is it really completely flat ? Pretty much . The land rises and falls only a few meters . The southeast , the hills rise to a height of a few hundred meters . There are mountains over 1000 meters high in your country . Yes , there are . They are not very big compared with the mountains in other countries . The coast of your country is very varied . The coast of my country is just made up of sandy beaches . That doesn ’ t sound too bad . Great for sunbathing ! The coast of my country changes even within a few kilometers . There are cliffs , then sandy beaches . Then rocks . There are lots of caves in the cliffs . There are also many small islands off the coast , but few people lives on them . There are many lakes and rivers in your country too . We also have many rivers , but only a few lakes . We also have waterfalls in the mountains . They make the landscapes look very scenic . The landscape has been shapes by millions of years of erosion , especially by water .
Summaries: The speakers discuss the landscapes of their respective countries, which are both small. My country is known for being flat, with only slight elevations in the southeast, while your country has mountains over 1000 meters high and a varied coastline with cliffs, sandy beaches, rocks, caves, and small islands. Both countries have rivers, but yours also has many lakes and waterfalls that create scenic landscapes shaped by millions of years of erosion.

Conversation: Do you speak only English in the class , or does your teacher explain everything to you in Spanish ? Oh , we never speak Spanish in class ! Miss.Parker speaks to us only in English . I suppose she's right.Does she speak English very slowly ? Not always.Sometimes we don't understand her.Then she has to repeat what she said . It must be interesting to study English . Mario and I are the best students in the class.Miss.Parker says that my pronunciation is very good . Is English pronunciation easy or difficult ? Sometimes it's difficult.Some words look different from the way one pronounces them .
Summaries: The speaker attends an English-only class taught by Miss. Parker, where students don't speak Spanish. While Miss. Parker speaks English slowly at times, she repeats herself when students don't understand. The speaker is a top student in the class and has received praise for their pronunciation from Miss. Parker.

Conversation: We have a class outing today . Have fun .
Summaries:
* Today is a class outing

Conversation: Excuse me , Professor . I have to talk to you about why my homework didn't get done . What happened that you didn't get it done ? I had to watch a football game instead . Well , you had more than one day ; couldn't you have fit it in on another day ? Yes , I think so . Either way , I only allow one missed assignment per semester . When will you be turning the make-up in ? I'll make it up next week . Fine , but it cannot happen again if you want an “ A ” in the class . OK , I can do that . Remember that you are in college now , not high school .
Summaries: The student apologizes for not completing homework and explains that they watched a football game instead. The professor acknowledges that there was time to complete it on another day but still had expectations. The student agrees to make up the assignment next week, but the professor emphasizes the importance of responsibility in college, stating that only one missed assignment is allowed per semester, and warns that repeated mistakes will affect their grade.

Conversation: Will you be done doing my hair soon ? Give me a little while longer . How much time do you need ? There you go . How do you like it ? I think it looks gorgeous . No problem , girl friend . I'll see you next time .

Conversation: Why do you look so gloomy ? What are you looking for ? My dissertation . I put it somewhere last night and I can't find it now . Did you finish typing yesterday ? Yes , I kept on typing it until midnight , but it is lost . Don't worry about it . It must be somewhere in your room . Let's see where you put it . Have you searched your drawers and the desk ? Yes , but there is nothing inside the drawers or on the desk . How about the shelf ? I've searched everywhere . Where on earth did I put it ? Don't get upset over it . At least you have another week to go . I have been working on it for a whole month and it's too late to write another . Just think of all my hard work that goes for nothing . How could I do such a thing ? Cheer up ! What I meant was that you can find it sometime during a week . There is no need to write a new one . Oh , what's this ? Is this your dissertation ? Let me see . Yes , that's it . Where did you find it ? You ’ Ve put it among these journals . My poor memory . Thank you very much .
Summaries: The speaker is frantically searching for their lost dissertation, which they had been working on for a month and needed to submit soon. They show signs of frustration and worry about losing all their hard work. The other person tries to calm them down, suggesting that it might be somewhere in their room and offering to help search. After searching various places, the dissertation is finally found hidden among some journals. The speaker is relieved and grateful for the discovery, and the conversation ends on a positive note.

Conversation: how come you're still up ? Shouldn't you be asleep by now ? I've been having a hard time sleeping lately . as far as I know , insomnia is usually caused by stress . What you need to do is to relax . you're probably right . I just wish it were that simple . How can I stop feeling so anxious all the time ? taking a yoga class or learning some relaxation techniques can help you cope with your stress . I don't really have time to learn anything new . I need to spend my time studying ! you need to take some breaks throughout the day . Studying all day isn ’ t very usually effective . you ’ re right . I usually end up starting at my computer or checking my email instead of doing my work for class . besides , it ’ s not difficult to learn yoga . In fact , I can teach you a move that ’ s supposed to help you fall asleep ! You just have to sit down like this , bend over and breath in deeply . that ’ s fantastic . I ’ m going to go try that out in my room now . good night ! good night , sleep tight ; don ’ t let the bed bugs bite !
Summaries: The speaker is awake at night, concerned about their own insomnia and stress. They discuss their worries with someone who is also struggling with sleep due to academic stress. The person suggests relaxation techniques like yoga and learning ways to cope with anxiety. They share a simple technique for falling asleep, which involves deep breathing and sitting comfortably.

Conversation: Before we begin eating , I'd like to present everyone with a gift from Taiwan . What is it ? It's a Taiwanese puppet doll . It's huge ! Yeah . They're usually this big . The craftsmanship is excellent . All the parts work . Thank you so much . Don't mention it .

Conversation: Are you a soccer fan ? Yes , I am . I like to watch soccer games on TV , but I don ’ t play . I watched every game of the 2002 World Cup . Which team is your favorite ? Italian . Conversation: What are you doing , awake ? I can't sleep ... But it's almost midnight ! Exactly . I'm too excited for Christmas morning . Also , I thought I heard Santa . Really ? How do you know it was Santa ? Well , I heard that naughty boys and girls get coal in their stockings , so I thought I'd be nice and make Santa cookies . I even left out some milk . I heard someone in the kitchen eating the cookies , so I came downstairs ! Hmm ... well I know that Santa won't come down the chimney with you hiding behind the tree , spying on him ! Really ? Really ! Let's go back upstairs and get back to bed . That way , we can let Santa do his job . Then when you wake up , it will be Christmas already ! O-K ... Hey , honey ! Is that you ? Don't eat all the cookies — I want some , too !
Summaries: A child is excitedly sharing with someone (presumably a parent or guardian) about hearing Santa Claus in their home. They claim to have heard Santa eating cookies and leaving milk, which they had intentionally left out. However, the other person seems skeptical, suggesting that it's unlikely Santa would visit while being watched. The child is enthusiastic and agrees to go back upstairs and let Santa do his job, promising to wake up to a Christmas morning surprise.

Conversation: Hey Eve , how are you ? I ’ m fine , Celia . And you ? I ’ m ok . I ’ m so busy ! Do you have a lot of homework ? Yes . Don ’ t you ? Of course I do ! Which class are you working on right now ? I ’ m studying for my chemistry exam tomorrow . Are you in Mrs Green ’ s class ? Yes . Are you ? Yes . We must have the same exam tomorrow ! Do you want to study together ? Sure . This library is too quiet though . Do you want to go to and empty classroom ? That sounds good . Ok . Let ’ s go !
Summaries: Eve and Celia chat about their busy schedules due to homework. They both have a chemistry exam tomorrow and attend Mrs. Green's class. They decide to study together, but find the library too quiet. Instead, they opt for an empty classroom to focus on their studying.

Conversation: Are you ready to go the concert ? Yes . Should we go there by bus so we aren't late ? Actually , why don't we go there by bike ? We could get stuck in traffic if we travel by bus in rush hour . That's true . Cycling is good for our environment , too . Let me just get my helmet then . Is your helmet comfortable ? Not really , but I liked the design , so I got it . Maybe you should think about getting a round helmet ; they're better . I'll think about it . Is that your new bicycle ? Yes , my father gave it to me for my birthday . Do you like it ? It's the newest 10 speed cycling mountain bike . These are really expensive ! Nothing but the best from my dad . I like everything about it except for the brakes . They are a bit sticky . I can fix those for you . Is there anything else wrong with it ? Well , my saddle is too low for me . Do you know how to change the height ? That's easy . It's important to have the saddle high enough so that your legs can extend fully when you are on your bicycle . Is that why my knees have felt sore after every time I've ridden my bike ? It's possible . Give me a minute and I can fix these for you and then we can go .
Summaries: The conversants discuss going to a concert and decide to travel by bike instead of bus due to potential traffic issues. They also consider the environmental benefits of cycling. One of them mentions they have a new bicycle, a 10-speed mountain bike, which was a birthday gift from their father. However, it has some issues with sticky brakes and an adjustable saddle that's too low for them. The other person offers to fix these problems before heading to the concert.

Conversation: Oh , God . It ’ s late . I ’ m afraid I have to leave . But you just got here . Can ’ t you stay a little longer and have some tea ? That ’ s very kind of you . But if I don ’ t go now I ’ ll miss the last bus . That ’ s too bad . Thank you for your hospitality . Thanks for coming . How about next time we meet at my place ? And I ’ ll treat you to Chinese food . I know how much you like it . We can order in and watch video too . Anything you like , I promise . Great idea . I ’ m looking forward to it . See you then . Well . I really do have to go . Good night then . See you tomorrow .
Summaries: A person has to leave unexpectedly due to missing a bus. They decline an offer for tea and instead propose a future meetup at their place, where they'll treat the other person to Chinese food and a video night. The plans are agreed upon and the person departs, looking forward to the next meeting.

Conversation: I'm going for a walk , Yi-jun . I need some time to myself . Don't you want to go to the visiting hours ? This sheet says they are tonight . I just can't right now . Everyone will be talking about Taylor and ... ... and maybe that's what we both need . I need to come to grips with his death first . And I also need to prepare a eulogy in case I'm asked to speak tomorrow . OK , but don't forget I'm here for you , and I know how you feel . It's my loss , too .
Summaries: Yi-jun needs time alone to process the death of someone close, likely Taylor. They're hesitant to attend visiting hours that night as it may be overwhelming. Yi-jun offers emotional support and understands the pain of loss, stating "it's my loss too".

Conversation: You're going to get into a lot of trouble if you do that . What makes you say that ? I don't see anything wrong with what we're doing ! That's just the problem . Have it your way , but don't say I didn't warn you .

Conversation: I am certain I am going to fail my English test . Why are you so pessimistic ? Because it's impossible to improve listening level within a week . Only for this reason ? Conversation: Hello ! So you are leaving today . Hello . Thank you for seeing me off . You actually don't need to bother . It is my pleasure to see you off . Thanks a lot . I hope to see you again . Conversation: Did you see the way that Brian came to work yesterday ? Ever since he came back from that conference in Silicon Valley , he's been coming to work dressed in jeans and sweatshirts . Conversation: It ’ s a beautiful day here in New Zealand at the Men ’ s Volleyball world championship . My name is Rick Fields and I ’ m joined by the man with the plan , Bob Copeland . Without a doubt , both teams are in top shape and this will prove to be a competitive match . The ref signals the start of the game and here we go . Ribero serves and China quickly receives the ball . Chen bumps it to the setter , and ... a very nice set by Chen ! Xu spikes it ! Wow , what a great hit ! The Brazilian blockers anticipated the play and tried to block him but he managed to get the ball in ! It ’ s China ’ s service now . What a superb jump serve by Li , oh , and we have a let serve . The ball was coming in fast and almost made it over the net . Brazil calls for a time out and we ’ ll be right back , after a short commercial break .
Summaries: The Men's Volleyball World Championship is underway, with powerhouse teams Brazil and China competing to qualify for the next round. The match begins with Brazil's Ribero serving, followed by China's Chen making an impressive set and Xu spiking the ball in despite the Brazilian blockers' efforts. China then serves again, but Li's jump serve results in a let serve, prompting Brazil to call a timeout.

Conversation: Hello , Grace . That's a beautiful skirt you have on . Where are you going ? I am going to attend an interview . What kind of job are you applying for ? My major is English . What's more , the color of your lipstick doesn't match your skin . As a teacher , you should be a little more sedate . Then what should I do ? Some of my friends tell me that being a teacher , the most important is the beauty of mind . You shouldn't pay too much attention to your appearance . You should appear frugal and prudent . Your experience and knowledge will gain the appreciation of your interviewer .

A friend advises that as a teacher, one should prioritize inner beauty over physical appearance, focusing instead on experience, knowledge, and a frugal/prudent demeanor to impress the interviewer.

Conversation: I don't know how John can put up with his son , who fools around without working . He's out of John's hands . Nothing he can do about such a black sheep . If I were him , I would give him a good talking-to . I would insist on his stopping fooling around like that .
Summaries: The speaker expresses frustration with someone else's son who does not work and instead fools around. The speaker believes this behavior is unacceptable and thinks the father (John) should take a firmer stance with his son, giving him a "good talking-to" to stop his lazy ways.

Conversation: London is such a historical city ! There ’ s history everywhere you look . There ’ s nelson ’ s column , built as a monument to one of the Britain ’ s great admirals and his important victory . He won the battle of Trafalgar in 1805 . I ’ m looking forward to seeing Westminster abbey , where many historical figures are buried , like Isaac Newton , the great mathematician and Winston Churchill , the great wartime leader . Nearby , on the banks of the thames , there ’ s the statue of Boadicea . She fought the Romans when they invaded Britain . Women have often played an important role in British history . Queen Elizabeth I built a navy strong enough to fight off the Spanish armada in 1588 . more recently , Margaret thatcher transformed british society in the 1980 ’ s . She was a very controversial leader . Are we going to visit the famous tower of London later ? There ’ s a lot to see there . Perhaps we should go tomorrow . I ’ m looking forward to seeing the famous castle and prison . Many historic figures were imprisoned there in the past . I really want to see the crown jewels too . I ’ Ve seen them before . They ’ re quite incredible . If you want to see historical figures in London , there ’ s one place you have to go . Where ’ s that ? Oh , I know ! Madame Tussaud ’ s the waxworks museum . There you can see british leaders , entertainers , criminals , and royalty . Sometimes , it ’ s hard to know who belongs in each section of the museum !
Summaries: London is steeped in history, with landmarks like Nelson's Column and Westminster Abbey holding significance. The city also honors women's roles in British history, such as Queen Elizabeth I and Margaret Thatcher. The Tower of London, a must-visit, features historic figures, the Crown Jewels, and a prison. Additionally, Madame Tussaud's waxworks museum showcases British leaders, entertainers, criminals, and royalty.

Conversation: so , how should we go to the theatre ? let's take the bus . I hate the bus system in London ! Every single time I take the bus , something bad happens to me or to someone else on the bus . we could take the subway , but we'd have to go three stops along one line and then change trains twice . train fares are twice as expensive as the bus fare , too . if we don't hurry up , we'll miss the show . Should we take the bus ? we're already late , so I think we had better take a taxi . I don't think we'll be able to find a taxi very easily during hush hours . Let's just take the bus . fine . Have a look at the timetable to find out when the next one arrives . it looks like it should be here in just a few minutes . don't worry . Nothing bad will happen . I'll even buy your ticket for you . thanks , that was nice of you . see , now something good has happened to you on a bus trip !
Summaries: The conversation is about how to get to the theatre. The speaker suggests taking the bus, but the other person is hesitant due to their negative experiences with rude drivers, poor timing, and lack of helpful passengers. They also mention that taking the subway would be inconvenient and expensive. The others suggest taking a taxi, but it may not be easily available during rush hour. Eventually, they decide to take the bus after all, and the speaker offers to buy their ticket, which seems to have a positive outcome.

Conversation: Mary , please go to the door . I hear the bell . It's the mailman , Mother . Here's a letter from Uncle George . Give it to me ... How wonderful ! He's coming to visit us . When's he coming ? He's coming by car on the twenty-fourth . He's staying from thetwenty-fourth to the twenty-sixth . Let me look at the calendar . Good ! The twenty-fourth is a Saturday . Is he coming alone ? No , he's coming with Aunt Cynthia and the girls . Mother , I don't remember the girls . How old are they ? Your cousin Fay is fifteen . Rosemary is older than Fay . She's seventeen . Are they going to stay here with us ? Of course . The girls can stay in your room with you . Mother , may we have a party ? If you like , but now we have to think about meals and many other things . Prepare the list , Mother . I can go shopping . I can go to the small stores.Everyone knows me there .
Summaries: Uncle George is visiting from the 24th to the 26th, arriving by car on a Saturday. He'll be accompanied by Aunt Cynthia and their two daughters, Fay (15) and Rosemary (17). The girls will stay with them, likely in the protagonist's room. The family plans to have a party during Uncle George's visit, but needs to consider meal arrangements and other details before making final plans.

Conversation: What's your little caper ? Come home so late ! We are all worried about you . Oh , I am terribly sorry . But I was so captivated with the singer at the subway exit . So I forgot the time . Singing ? At the subway exit ? Oh , it sounds like someone needs some money . Oh , no , the guy was a musician who just sang . He played the guitar and sang so many cool pop songs . Many people were drawn to his music and there was no hat on the floor . He sang for appreciation , but not for money . It is just pop song , you could have sung there too if you want it . Oh , no , it was a kind of pop art . I like it but I couldn't do it that well . Honey , just do it next time . Have you heard of the real art in the subway station in Russia ? No , but tell me some . I am interested . Many oil painting exhibitions are there . That is a kind of Museum Exhibition . Are there many people there ? Do you think people actually like them ? I am sure you will . There are some works , and some students who major in painting interpret the meaning for visitors . And people can enjoy the paintings while waiting for the train . But I still prefer the pop music in the subway . Both the pop music and the oil painting ate arts , but with different aesthetic values . Dad , you talk well , but can you appreciate that kind of art ? Not well enough , but I'm learning .
Summaries: The speaker returns home late, apologizing for their tardiness. They explain they were captivated by a musician playing guitar and singing pop songs at a subway exit. The music was appreciated by many, not seeking payment. The conversation shifts to discussing art in subway stations, specifically in Russia where oil painting exhibitions are held. The speaker notes that while both art forms have different aesthetic values, they can coexist.

Conversation: It's wonderful to be in the mountains after a hustle bustle week . Indeed . I love the smell of the grass and trees . They certainly refresh my mind . Can we stop here for a while ? I don't think so . Let's walk by the stream . I am sure we can find the waterfall on the map . OK . I have a good pair of hiking boots . It should not be a big problem . I also brought a bottle of water and some provisions . If you are hungry , you can let me know . You are kind . Look there is a big tree over there , it looks like a thousand-year-old tree . Well , it is a birch tree.It is not as old as you think . How do you know ? Because its trunk is not thick enough to be like a thousand-year-old tree .
Summaries: Two friends are taking a break from their busy week by hiking in the mountains. They stop to admire the scenery, spot a vulture flying overhead, and then head towards a stream to find a waterfall marked on their map. One friend notes that they have the necessary gear, including water and provisions, and offers to share if the other is hungry. As they walk, they come across an old-looking birch tree, which one of them correctly identifies as not being nearly a thousand years old due to its relatively thin trunk.

Conversation: Would you like to come over for dinner tonight ? Sure , but I have to tell you that I've become a vegetarian . I don't eat any kind of meat . When did you decide to become a vegetarian ? I saw a program a few months ago about how animals are raised for human consumption . I haven't been able to eat a single piece of meat since . That's great . Do you find that you eat a lot more fruit and vegetables now ? Definitely . I've also been buying organic fruit and vegetables , which is more expensive , but much better for you because they don't have any pesticides on them . You've really turned into a health nut , haven't you ? I guess you could say that . Eating fruit and vegetables helps keep you healthy . I've lost 5 pounds and I feel great ! How do you get enough protein in your diet ? Well , I eat a lot more tofu , beans , nuts and some fish . Well , don't worry about dinner . I'll only make vegetarian dishes for you . Do you like sushi ? I prefer cooked fish to raw fish , but if you really like it , make it . How about a spicy tofu and vegetable stir-fry ? That sounds great . What time should I come over ? Dinner will be ready at about 7:30 pm , so you can come over at 7 p . m . Sounds good . See you there !
Summaries: The speaker invites someone over for dinner and reveals they've become a vegetarian due to seeing a program about animal treatment. They now eat more fruit and veggies, including organic ones to avoid pesticides. The host shares their experience of losing weight and feeling healthy, and discusses protein sources like tofu, beans, and fish. They offer to make a vegetarian dish, such as spicy tofu stir-fry, and suggest 7:30 pm for dinner.

It is really a fun game .
