Conversation: Do you like watching the Winter Olympic Games ? Of course . It's the tradition game in winter , and with good reason . Don't you like watching it ? Of course I do . I love it . All the games are exciting and the competitors are respectable . That's true . For various reasons , it takes more to hold a fierce game for Winter Olympics than it does for Summer Olympics . You know , the low temperature may cause many problems . Yeah . What's the difference between the Winter Olympics and the Summer Olympics ? When the Olympic Games started in modern times , only summer events were included . When it grew popular , there came the Winter Olympic Games , which includes a variety of winter sports . I see . Then , what's your favorite winter sport ? Figure skating . In my eye , nothing beats it . Then you must know Shen Due and Hao Hongbo . Oh , I didn't expect you to know them . But yes , I love them not only because of many medals they've won , but also because of their spirits . You should go to talk with May . She is a big fan of them too . Sure . What about you ? What do you like about the Olympics ? For me , the Olympics for the disabled always catches my heart . It makes me understand that perseverance makes the impossible possible . Hey , young man , you are so deep today . I always am . You just didn't notice .
Summaries: The conversation begins with a shared enthusiasm for watching the Winter Olympic Games. The speakers discuss the unique challenges of hosting Winter Olympics due to low temperatures and the variety of winter sports involved. One speaker mentions their favorite sport, figure skating, and shares admiration for Chinese figure skaters Shen Due and Hao Hongbo. Another speaker reveals that they are moved by the Olympic events for people with disabilities, highlighting the importance of perseverance. The conversation concludes with a nod to the speakers' depth and thoughtfulness.

Conversation: It is difficult for old people to do away with old ideas . So the reform cannot be carried out well . Government is making efforts to change situation . Easier said than done .

It's noted that it's hard for older individuals to adapt to new ideas, which can hinder the success of reform efforts. Despite this, the government is actively working to address the issue and bring about change. However, as the saying goes, "easier said than done," implying that overcoming these obstacles will be a difficult and complex process.

Conversation: Does she make any sense to you ? No . It's all Greek to me . She's speaking French , not Greek . I know that . I mean I couldn't understand her at all . Me neither . All I have to do is study French hard . I wish you the best of luck .
Summaries: The conversation revolves around someone who is trying to communicate in French, but it doesn't make sense to the speaker. The speaker acknowledges that they know French isn't Greek, and understands that studying it hard would help them understand what's being said.

Conversation: How are you going all these days ? Fine , thanks . But you look depressed . I have some problem with my work . Is it serious ? I can solve it , thanks . How about your family ? Everything is Okay . And as soon as I see my son at home , all my worries vanish into the blue .

The person then opens up about having problems at work, which they're confident they can resolve. They also share that everything is okay in their family, but mention that seeing their son after a long day alleviates all their worries.

Conversation: So what do you feel like doing this evening ? How about going to the cinema ? Ah , that's a good idea . But I heard the film club of our school would show a film for free . Conversation: You ’ re going to set up your own law office , aren ’ t you ? Yes . After so many years of hard work , I ’ d rather I had an office of my own . Summaries: The speaker announces their plan to open their own law office after years of hard work. They express gratitude for an offer of help and appreciate the well-wishes from someone else.

Conversation: Wow , is that your sports car ? Yes , do you like it ? I love it ! I used to always want to drive a green jaguar . Is it in good condition ? The friend reveals that the car needs a new engine, which would be expensive, and also requires servicing for other issues such as faulty heating controls and poor brakes. The owner hasn't had it serviced in years due to personal circumstances (having a child), but is considering getting it fixed eventually.

Conversation: Can you play baseball with me today ? No , I can't . I'm sorry . I have to help my mother . We're going to move tomorrow . Where's the new house ? Is it far from here ? No , it's not far . It's near our old house . Can I help you pack ? Sure . Thanks .

Conversation: I think I need a new notebook . Why ? Is there some new , cool computer out on the market ? You bet there is . Feast your eyes on this puppy ! That's a notebook ? Believe it ! It looks more like a toy , or a cool briefcase !

Conversation: Dalian is a beautiful city . Do you agree ? I suppose I do . The climate here is pleasant . You said it . This city is really comfortable to live in . It sure is . No other city can match it . It's heaven . Well , if you live in other cities as long as enough , you will love them just as much . Maybe . That's for sure .

They assert that no other city can compare, but also acknowledge that familiarity breeds affection, suggesting that people may develop a love for different cities given enough time.

Conversation: Ah , Michelle , hi . I was hoping to see you . How have you been ? How's the family ? Oh , hello , Mr . Campbell . I'm fine and Jack's doing well . How are you ? I'm fine thanks . I got your report this morning . Thank's for that . Are you joining the conference today ? Yes , I'm leaving at four pm . Conversation: Have you read all these crazy things that are going on around the world ? What do you mean ? I was reading about how some people get tricked or drugged in their hotel rooms and have their organs removed ! Then they are sold on the black market . Don't tell me you actually believe all that ? Don't be so gullible , they are just urban legends . They are just stories people make up to scare you . Well , I was also reading about how some popular songs have subliminal or even satanic messages if you play them backwards ! Can you believe that ? You really think an artist or song writer is going to go through the trouble of putting subliminal or satanic messages in a song ? Don't be so naive ! Well maybe you are right , but how about the story of how KFC has rows of headless chickens which are super grown in order to get bigger chickens faster ! Sounds a bit too far fetched to be true , don't you think ?
Summaries: The conversation is about debunking urban legends and false information. The speaker shares examples of supposed shocking events, such as organ harvesting from hotel room victims and subliminal/satanic messages in popular songs when played backwards. They are dismissed as mere myths or fabrications meant to scare or deceive. The KFC example is also brought up as another outlandish claim that seems too unbelievable to be true. Overall, the conversation emphasizes critical thinking and not believing everything one reads without fact-checking or verifying sources.

Conversation: Hi Bob , this is my friend Mary . I am very pleased to meet you . Bob is in advertising . That sounds an interesting job , Bob .
Summaries: The conversation begins with the introduction of Mary's friend, Bob, who works in advertising. Mary expresses her pleasure at meeting Bob and finds his job intriguing. This sets the stage for a potential discussion about Bob's work in the field of advertising.

Conversation: Wow ! I can ’ t believe I ’ m standing here ! What are you so excited about ? I ’ m standing in front of an exquisite work of art ! What ’ s the big deal ? This information shocks the other person, making them realize the significance of what they are seeing.

Conversation: Did you see the 2005 Grammy Awards on TV last night . Yeah . I was so happy , because my favorite singer , Ricky Martin won ' Best Latin Pop Performance ' . Summaries: Ricky Martin won "Best Latin Pop Performance" at the 2005 Grammy Awards, making him a frequent award winner. Known for his diverse vocal range and energetic performances, he gained international popularity with his song "La Copa de la Vida", which was played during the football World Cup. His fan base spans across the globe, from America to Russia, England to Taiwan, Norway to Australia, showcasing his widespread appeal.

Conversation: Ben cancelled his trip . How come ? Because General , his dog , got sick . He's such a mother hen .
Summaries: Ben cancelled his trip because his dog, General, fell ill.

Conversation: Hi Jane , you look great . You too . Have you lost some weight ? Yes , I took off 4 kilos . I am glad you notice it . Not some crazy diet fat I hope . No no , I just changed my eating habits . I eat a balance meal . and I eat less than before . Good for you , keep it up .

We have to go now . This sheet tells the visiting hours and funeral time and location .

The speaker's whole family was present, including their mom and dad who are likely devastated since they had only one son.

Conversation: OK . Steven , you're looking at a picture . Please describe what you see ! Uh , I can see a red double decker bus . It's the kind of bus you'll see very often in London . It's .. I guess it's not too expensive , but the minimum price you would pay is , for a short journey , is about a pound . Mm , yeah , who can you see on the bus ? Can you pick out anyone on the bus who looks interesting ? Hmm , yeah , well this girl here at the back , that's leaning on the door , um , she looks really bored , actually . Maybe she is going to work or something and she doesn't want to go ! Is that how you feel on the bus ? Uh , well , no , not really , because I haven't worked in England for a long time , so I haven't taken a bus for a long time . So , so you're British , do you missing them ? Um , yes , sometimes . Sometimes .
Summaries: Steven describes a picture of a red double-decker bus with London street names (Chelsea, Sloane Square, Victoria, and Herring Cross) indicating it's in London. He shares his personal experience riding these buses many times, noting they're now mostly found in big cities, not all over England like before. The conversation also touches on the fare (about £1 for a short journey) and the bored-looking girl at the back of the bus. Steven reveals he's British, hasn't worked in England for a long time, and sometimes misses the buses.

Conversation: Is the view going to be ok ? Don ’ t worry , you did a good job and it should be fine . I ’ ll do my best . That ’ s the way to go .

Summaries: Bob appears worried and pale, having not slept well. He confides in someone about being under pressure from his boss, who assigned two projects with looming deadlines. Bob feels overwhelmed but wants to talk through his stress. The listener offers empathy, acknowledging their own understanding of feeling stressed, and encourages Bob to take it easy.

Conversation: Which team won ? The Spur . What was the score ? They managed a 99:80 victory .
Summaries: The San Antonio Spurs (also known as "The Spur") emerged victorious with a dominant performance, winning the game by a significant margin of 19 points (99-80).

Conversation: What good sunshine ! Let's go and get a suntan on the balcony . I've had enough of it while working under the sun in the day . I don't need any more sun-tan . However, they caution that excessive tanning can cause skin damage and even lead to skin cancer, so moderation is key.

Conversation: Would you like to stretch your legs ? Why not ? Let's get a soft drink . Do we have enough time ? Yes , we do . The performance is excellent . After taking a short break, they head back to their seats as the performance is about to start.

Conversation: It's a beautiful day , isn't it ? Yes , isn't it . Do you now the temperature today ? It's beautiful 75 degrees . How nice . I hope the weather will stay like this for the whole week . I'm going on the canoe trip this weekend . Not a good plan . The TV weather forecast says the hurricane is coming this weekend , and the temperature will also drop to 66 degrees . What a nuisance ! Every time I plan to go canoeing or camping , a storm comes along . The sky gets dark , the wind starts to howl and the temperature drops.Well , I'd better stay home . I never make any definite weekend plan until Friday morning . Then after listening to the weather temperature , I make my plans . That's smart . I'm going to start doing the same thing .
Summaries: The conversation discusses a beautiful day with a temperature of 75 degrees, but the speaker's plans for a canoe trip this weekend are ruined by a TV weather forecast predicting a hurricane and dropping temperatures. The speaker reflects on how storms always seem to coincide with their outdoor plans, causing them to cancel or adjust their activities at the last minute. As a result, they've learned to wait until Friday morning to make definite weekend plans, depending on the weather forecast.

Conversation: are you ready to go the concert ? yes . Should we go there by bus so we aren't late ? actually , why don't we go there by bike ? Summaries: The two friends are planning to attend a concert together. They discuss transportation options, deciding to travel by bike instead of bus due to potential traffic congestion. One friend mentions that cycling is good for the environment and notes that their helmets could be improved (the other friend's helmet has a design flaw). The conversation turns to their bicycles, with one friend showing off their new 10-speed mountain bike as a birthday gift. However, they mention some issues with the brakes being sticky and the saddle height being too low, which is causing knee soreness after riding. The friends agree that getting these problems fixed before heading out will be important for their comfort and safety during the ride to the concert.

Conversation: Next please ! Hello sir , may I see your passport please ? Yes , here you go . Will you be checking any bags today . Yes , I ’ d like to check three pieces . I ’ m sorry , sir . Airline policy allows only two pieces of checked luggage , at twenty kilograms each , plus one piece of carry-on luggage . I will have to charge you extra for the additional suitcase . What ? Why ! I am taking an intercontinental flight ! I ’ m flying sixteen thousand CMS ! How am I supposed to only take two , twenty kilo bags ? That ’ s absurd ! I am sorry , sir , there ’ s nothing I can do . You cannot board the flight with that large bag either.Carry - on bags must fit in the over-head compartment or under your seat . That bag is clearly too big . Now I see . You charge next to nothing for an international ticket , but when it comes to charging for any other small thing , you charge an arm and a leg ! So tell me , miss , how much will I have to pay for all of this . Let ’ s see ... six hundred and twenty-five US dollars . That ’ s more than my round-trip ticket !
Summaries: A passenger checks in for an international flight with three pieces of luggage, exceeding the airline's policy of two checked bags (20 kg each) plus one carry-on bag. The airline charges extra for the additional suitcase, which the passenger disputes as unfair given the size of their trip. The carrier insists on charging $625 for the excess baggage, exceeding the cost of the ticket itself.

Conversation: You ready ? Am I ready for what ? Are you ready to transfer to a new school tomorrow ? Oh . Yes , I ’ m ready to transfer . You ’ re not nervous , are you ? I ’ m very nervous . Conversation: Did you see Victor on Wednesday , Wendy ? Yes . We went for a walk in the woods near the highway . Wasn ’ t it cold on Wednesday ? Yes . It was very cold and windy . We wore heavy wool sweaters and walked quickly to keep warm . It ’ s so nice and quiet in the woods . Yes . Farther away from the highway it was very quiet and there were birds and squirrels everywhere . We counted over twenty squirrels . It sounds wonderful . Did you take lunch with you ? Yes , we bought veal sandwiches . We stopped around twelve , and we ate and watched the squirrels , but it was too windy to sit long . It was a very nice walk , anyway .
Summaries: Wendy and Victor went for a walk in the woods near the highway on Wednesday. It was cold and windy, so they wore heavy wool sweaters and walked quickly to stay warm. They enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere, spotting over 20 squirrels and seeing birds everywhere. They stopped for lunch at around noon, eating veal sandwiches while watching the wildlife, but the strong wind made it hard to sit for long.

Conversation: Wow ! That ’ s a pretty dress , but it ’ s too expensive . Yeah , it is ! Why is it so expensive ? It ’ s because of good quality and the fine design . I don ’ t think it ’ s worth that money . Anyhow , this dress is really elegant .

Conversation: I've been told that you are a very successful businessman abroad . I wonder how you managed to achieve such success ? Oh , through a lot of hard work , of course . Conversation: What's the news on our website ? How effective do you think it is from a marketing standpoint ? We've been able to survey and track some of the information of our website users through some cookie technology , and it's surprising to see the results . What kinds of hits are we getting on our company's website ? From the numbers , it seems nearly half of the visitors who stumble onto our page pick up the link not from network browsers or search engines , but from our circular insert . That means our consumers are purposefully and actively seeking information about our products and services through the web format . Based on these findings , I am completely convinced the internet is the marketing power of the future ! You really think that many people turn to the internet to find product information.What about the old standbys of word mouth and print media ? Well , these mediums are still important ... they aren't a thing of the past ... But I think they might be less important now than in the past . The technology age has arrived !
Summaries: The company's website is attracting visitors, with nearly half coming from circular inserts rather than search engines or network browsers. This suggests consumers are actively seeking product information online. The speaker believes this indicates the internet will be a powerful marketing tool in the future, while still acknowledging the importance of traditional methods like word-of-mouth and print media, which may be less significant now due to the rise of technology.

Conversation: What do you know about Julia Roberts ? Her acting is OK . I mean her personality . I'm afraid I know less than you do.Tell me more about her , will you ?
Summaries:
Julia Fiona Roberts was born on October 28, 1967, in Smyrna, Georgia. She rose to fame with her breakout role as Vivian Ward in the 1990 romantic comedy "Pretty Woman," which became a global phenomenon.

Throughout her career, Julia has appeared in over 60 films, including:

* Romantic comedies like "Runaway Bride" (1999) and "Eat Pray Love" (2010)
* Dramas like "Erin Brockovich" (2000), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress
* Thrillers like "The Pelican Brief" (1993) and "Ocean's Eleven" (2001)

Julia is known for her versatility, having played a wide range of roles in various genres. She has been recognized with numerous awards and nominations, including four Golden Globe Awards.

Off-screen, Julia is a devoted mother to three children and has been married twice, first to actor Lyle Lovett and then to cameraman Danny Moder.

Overall, Julia Roberts is a beloved Hollywood star known for her captivating on-screen presence, down-to-earth personality, and dedication to her craft.

Conversation: I've never seen a machine like this before and need some help . Sure , no problem . What are you trying to get ? I want to buy a drink . OK . This machine needs you to use that change machine first to get correct change . I've got the correct change already . First you put your money in the dollar slot or the coin slot . The dollars have to be smooth . OK , what next ? Just know that sometimes the money doesn't go in perfectly the first time and you have to try again . OK , next ? Choose what you want and push the button . Sometimes it takes a couple of tries . I agree with you . Hope that works for you !
Summaries: A person is trying to buy a drink from a machine but needs help. The attendant explains that the machine requires using the change machine first, then inserting money into the dollar or coin slot (with smooth bills), and finally selecting the desired item by pushing the button.

Conversation: Honey , wait ! I've sprained my ankle . Oh , my god , are you OK ? Of course not ! Come on , sit down , and let me have a look . The pain is killing me . I told you to wear running shoes . But you don't listen . I thought leather shoes will do just as well . Hold on , don't move , I will take care of that . What are you going to do ? I will get some ice , and put it on your ankle.How does that feel ? God ! It's freezing ! Be brave . Don't worry . You will be able to walk soon .
Summaries: A person gets injured while trying to help someone else who has sprained their ankle. Despite the initial shock and pain, they try to assist by getting ice to reduce the swelling. The person with the sprain is initially hesitant due to the cold temperature but eventually agrees to let them continue treating it, reassured that it will help in the long run.

Conversation: So Chris , I've heard that you're from a big family . How many people ? Nine total . Seven children and my parents . Seven children ? That's a lot . Why did your parents have so many ? Well , my mother came from a big family , and wanted to have one of her own . My father was an only child , and didn't really care about having a large family , but my mother talked him into it . Jeez , seven children . That must have a lot of problems . We have four children in my family and my grandparents can never get our names right . It can be hard , and there are certain sacrifices you have to make . Like what ? I assume that there's no privacy . That's one . Another is the lack of personal property . Everything you have , from toys to clothes , is used by your brothers and sisters . Especially clothes . Three quarters of my wardrobe are hand-me-downs . And the age gap is also annoying . There's a ten-year difference between my younger brother and me . We have nothing in common . Same problem here . There's an 18 - year gap between the oldest and youngest child in my family . The last child was born just as the oldest was going to college . Well , at least going to college won't be too bad . Since both of your parents are college professors , they must give you reduced tuition at the college . They do , but it doesn't help too much . Having seven children means that the money situation in my home is always pretty tight .
Summaries: Chris talks about his large family with 9 members (7 siblings and parents). His mother came from a big family and wanted to replicate it, while his father was an only child who didn't initially want many kids. Chris discusses the challenges they faced, including lack of privacy, shared personal property (especially clothes), and age gaps between siblings. As both sets of parents are college professors, they do offer reduced tuition rates, but the financial strain of a large family remains.

We are kind and welcoming people.It is not a secret society or something like that . Alright . But will we sing ? Yes , but you don't even have to sing . If you want to sing along , you can . I don't know the words . There is a songbook . All the words are in the songbook.Many people have to read the words . And will I go up to the front to have the bread and wine ? No . That is something only true Catholics do.So if you come to the church as a visitor , you only listen to the service.But you shouldn't go up to the altar for the bread and wine.Only after someone joins the church , then they go up for the Eucharist . Eu-char-ist ? What is that ? That is the special word for the ritual of the bread and wine.The Catholics call it the Eucharist . It doesn't sound like an English word . It's not . It's an ancient Greek word . It means gratitude . Alright . Well , I feel more comfortable now.Now I understand I am welcome as a visitor . Of course you are . I wouldn't ask you otherwise .
Summaries: Ryan invites someone who has never been to church before and is feeling nervous. They express concerns about what's expected of them, but Ryan reassures them that they don't have to pretend to be Catholic or participate in certain rituals. As a visitor, they can simply listen to the service and don't need to sing along or receive communion (Eucharist). The person feels more at ease once understanding they're welcome as a guest, and Ryan confirms it's okay for them to come.

Conversation: Hey Jack . How were your classes this semester ? They were not too bad . I really liked my poli-sci class . Would you consider it your favorite class ? If that was your favorite , I think I will check it out .
Summaries: The speaker, Jack, had decent classes this semester. His poli-sci class stood out as being particularly enjoyable, but he wouldn't call it his absolute favorite. Conversation: What are you reading ? It ’ s an article about language . It talks about the idea of having a single global language . It seems that English already is the main global language . Does the article suggest that there should be an artificial language like Esperanto as the world language . Actually , it suggest English . The main argument is that English is already being studied as a second language in most countries-china , India , mexico , Nigeria , Pakistan , and japan . So beginning again with a language like Esperanto would be wasteful . The second argument is that English is used in modern technology far more that any other language . Most emails are sent in English and the vast majority of website use English . Does the article say anything about other language ? How will they survive in an English-speaking world ? The article points out that many languages have been lost and will be lost , but others will continue to be used for generation , even if English continues to be the dominant language . Right . All the people who speak Chinese . Hindi , French and Spanish aren ’ t suddenly going to stop using those languages . Exactly . The article suggests that those languages will be used , but that they will only rarely be used in international communication between non-native speakers . In that case , I shall continue to learning a few basic phrases in other languages .
Summaries: The article discusses the idea of having a single global language, with English already being the dominant language. It argues that starting anew with an artificial language like Esperanto would be inefficient since English is widely studied as a second language worldwide. Additionally, English is heavily used in modern technology, such as emails and websites. The article acknowledges that other languages will still exist and be used within their respective cultures, but notes that they may only rarely be used in international communication between non-native speakers.

Do you take cream or sugar with your tea ? Actually , could I have some milk with that ? Definitely . Would you like skim or whole milk ? Skim , please . That'd be very nice . Thanks ... oh no . Summaries: The speaker had a great dinner and was impressed that the host knew how to cook. They discussed dessert, with the host offering strawberry shortcake. After enjoying their treats, they prepared to leave because the host received news about their sister being in a car accident. The host apologized and decided to go alone since they only have a two-seater car.

Conversation: You look upset , is there anything wrong ? Yes , to tell you the truth , there is . What is it ? Well , I've lost my wallet and my ID card . Oh , that's too bad ! I am sorry to hear that ! Forget it , there is no use crying over the spilled milk .
Summaries: The speaker appears upset and reveals they have lost their wallet and ID card. The listener expresses sympathy and condolence for their loss.

Conversation: Diana , do you like the perfume I gave you ? It ’ s good . But to tell you the truth , I don ’ t wear perfume . I ’ m sorry . I didn ’ t know that . That ’ s all right . Thank you all the same .
Summaries: Diana received a perfume from someone, who asked if she liked it. Diana said yes, but revealed that the giver doesn't wear perfume themselves. Despite this, Diana appreciated the gift and accepted it with gratitude.

Conversation: Are there any interesting stories in the newspaper today ? There are a few stories about natural disasters . There is a massive forest fire in Australia . It covers several square kilometers of land has destroyed many more square kilometers . Was it caused accidentally or naturally ? Sometimes it gets so hot that fires begin naturally in Australia and Africa . Nobody knows at the moment , but it has been very hot there recently . The drought in Africa is causing starvation . Millions of people have migrated to try and find food . What is the international community doing to help ? The European union has sent several plants with relief supplies . Several countries have sent soldiers to distribute food and medical supplies . Refugee camps have been set up across the region . How many countries have been affected ? Six have been seriously affected , but the refugees are also migrating to several surrounding countries . I saw on the tv yesterday that there has been another earthquake in Iran . Yes . There have been a few there recently . They say that this one was not a big quake . The Iranians are dealing with it on their own . They have purchased some special equipment to find people buried under rubble . Does the newspaper say anything about casualties ? So far , less than 20 people have died , but over 100 are in hospital .
Summaries: The newspaper reports on several natural disasters. A massive forest fire is burning in Australia, covering multiple square kilometers and destroying even more. The cause is unknown, but it coincides with a heatwave. In Africa, a severe drought has caused starvation, leading to millions of people migrating for food. The international community is responding with relief supplies and soldiers to distribute aid. Refugee camps have been set up across the region. Six countries have been severely affected, with surrounding nations also experiencing refugee migration. Additionally, Iran has experienced another earthquake, which while not severe, has resulted in over 100 hospitalizations and less than 20 deaths, with the Iranian government handling the response on their own.

Conversation: Where are you going for your trip ? I think Hebes is a good place . But I heard the north of China are experiencing severe sandstorms ! Really ? Yes , it's said that Hebes was experiencing six degree strong winds . How do these storms affect the people who live in these areas ? The report said the number of people with respiratory tract infections tended to rise after sandstorms . The sand gets into people's noses and throats and creates irritation . It sounds that sandstorms are trouble for everybody ! You are quite right .
Summaries: The speaker is considering a trip to Hebei province in China, but is warned about severe sandstorms occurring in the north of China. The storms bring strong winds and sand particles that can cause respiratory issues and irritation, leading to an increase in cases of respiratory tract infections among locals.

Conversation: hi , how are you doing ? everything's great . And you ? same here . Have you seen any new films recently ? no , I haven't had a chance to . I found it is so close to our life . it reflects some of our difficulties in this ever-changing world . you said it . You know , the divorce rate has been on the rise in recent years . well , it's said that a lot of young people favor getting married quickly which tend end quickly too . I know a couple who divorced a week after getting married . oh , that's too short-lived . that's true . It's said the short-lived marriage is typical of the post - 80s generation . I can't agree more . The only-child generation in China tends to know little about marriage . definitely . They don't take relationships and marriages very seriously . in their mind , love is nothing but passion and marriage is over once the passion is gone . I think , as the saying goes as the saying goes haste makes waste , it is the same thing with marriage .
Summaries: The conversation starts with a casual greeting, followed by discussions about watching films and TV series. The topic shifts to Chinese-Style Divorce, a TV series that reflects modern society's difficulties in relationships and marriages. The speakers agree that the divorce rate has been increasing due to young people getting married too quickly, which often ends in short-lived marriages. They attribute this trend to the post-80s generation's lack of understanding about marriage, leading them to view love as just passion and marriage as fleeting. The conversation concludes with a reminder that "haste makes waste" is relevant not only for personal relationships but also for marriages.

Conversation: We should keep Frank at arm's length . Yeah . He's known as a sly dog . He's done many people in . He hits below the belt . And he may cash in on people whenever chances are provided .

The speaker advises keeping their distance to avoid potential harm or exploitation.

Conversation: Did you read the letter in the paper about smoking ? The person who wrote that must be crazy . I don't think so . I think the government should do everything it can to discourage people from smoking . Maybe so . But a law banning cigarettes would do no good . No.You can't suddenly make smoking illegal . But the government could prohibit smoking in public places like cinemas and theaters .
Summaries: The conversation revolves around a letter published about smoking. The speaker thinks the author is "crazy" for opposing anti-smoking efforts, but disagrees, advocating for government measures to discourage smoking. They suggest prohibiting smoking in public places like cinemas and theaters, rather than making cigarettes illegal outright.

Conversation: So Beth , what kind of music do you listen to ? I listen to a lot of hip hop . What about you ? I mostly listen to pop music , but I like a lot of different stuff . Yes , me too . I mostly listen to hip hop , but there are many genres of music I like .
Summaries: Beth and the other person discuss their favorite types of music. The other person listens to a lot of hip-hop, while Beth primarily enjoys pop music but also appreciates various genres.

Conversation: Tomorrow's Carl's birthday ? Yes.Let ' s hold a birthday party for him , shall we ? Good idea ! Let's make ready , then .
Summaries: The topic of the conversation is planning a birthday party for Carl tomorrow, which is his actual birthday. The party will likely involve preparations and arrangements to be made beforehand.

Conversation: I know I'm a blabbermouth , but what do you think she should do , John ? Honey , we're in the museum now . We're not here to discuss your coworker's love life . We're here to enjoy the great paintings by Picasso ! I know ! But it's really important to her ! Her whole life could be ruined by this man ! You're making a federal case out of it . One unhealthy love affair can't ruin anything . It could even make your life more interesting . Are you serious , John ? All I'm trying to say is that life is ... like ... er ... this painting .
Summaries: The conversation revolves around a friend's coworker who is having an unhealthy obsession with someone, and the speaker is worried about the consequences it may have on their life. The speaker's partner, John, is urging them to calm down and not make a big deal out of it, suggesting that one love affair can't ruin everything and might even bring excitement.

Conversation: Don ’ t you think it would be an idea to name the ship Dolphin ? All right , if that would make you happy . So you ’ Ve got something on your mind , I guess . Well , nothing really serious .
Summaries: The conversation begins with a suggestion to name a ship "Dolphin". The speaker is open to the idea, but it's not a priority. They then ask what's been on their counterpart's mind, and they mention that it's not anything serious, implying that it's just a minor concern or thought.

Conversation: Have you decided what you are going to take next semester ? Well , I'm an English major , you know.So I came here to make sure I'm taking the right things . Good . I think it's a good idea . Our department should require meetings like this . I want to finish my degree in four years.So I don't want to forget to take classes I need . I have a friend who has to stay in college another year.She didn't know until recently . There were some classes she needed to take to graduate.She didn't know about them . Yes , that happens . I brought my transcript from my first year.Here . And here is the list of courses I plan to take in the fall . Alright . Good . I see you've already taken six credits of your breadth requirements.You have one botany class and one chemistry class . And political science.So that's nine credits . Did you take English Composition 201 ? No , I don't need to . I took Advanced Placement English in high school.So I'm not required to take composition . Excellent . I see you have the 18th century poetry class for next semester.And the modern novel class . You haven't taken a Shakespeare class yet . No , I thought I would take it later . Actually , I recommend you take Shakespeare sooner rather than later . Well , I suppose I could cross out the 18th century poetry class . I have to see when the Shakespeare class meets . Let me look at the timetable.Shakespeare meets Monday , Wednesday and Friday at 11 I can take it then . I have that time slot free . Good . I recommend it . Shakespeare is of course enormously important.We want our students to take the class as soon as they can.And Professor Friedman is an excellent teacher . I'll take it then . Tell me , Lisa , what made you decide to be an English major ? I want to be an English professor in the future . I love studying literature , and I want to teach it . Really ? That's great to know . That's the reason I want to finish my B . A . in four years.Because I know I will be in school a long time . I want to start the M . A . and Ph . D . program as soon as possible .
Summaries: The speaker, an English major, seeks advice on course selection for next semester. They have a transcript from their first year and a list of planned courses. The advisor suggests taking Shakespeare's class earlier rather than later, citing its importance in the curriculum and Professor Friedman's excellent teaching. The student is motivated to finish their B.A. in four years to pursue an M.A. and Ph.D. program in English literature.

Conversation: hey , Lucas , how was your trip to Paris ? it was wonderful , but I was so tired . did you go to the top of the Eiffel Tower ? yes , that was the first thing we did . Conversation: Excuse me . Yes , Miss , what can I do for you ? I ordered my dish about a half an hour ago , but it hasn't arrived yet . When the order arrives, the server again apologizes for the delay and offers a complimentary glass of wine as an apology.

Conversation: How do you like this waltz ? It's very nice , I like it very much . Well , then , may I invite you for the first dance ? My pleasure . I'm glad you say so , you dance beautifully too . It's lucky that I got a partner . Thank you for your compliments.It ' s just that you are a good leader . Do you like the fox-trot and tango ? Yes . And what dances do you do best ? Disco is my favorite . I like it better than any other dances because it can release one's pent-up feelings , and is a healthy exercise . But I don't do the rock and roll and the break dance . Oh , well , the music has stopped . Thank you for the dance . My pleasure . Let's go and have a drink . Fine .

Conversation: What's the Mountaineering Club doing this weekend ? We are going to climb a cliff on the Yangtze River . How hard is the climb ? Summaries: The Mountaineering Club is planning to climb a cliff on the Yangtze River this weekend. The climb is considered very difficult due to limited hand and foothold opportunities. Last week, they rappelled down a 300-foot cliff, which was exciting but also challenging. The speaker invites someone to join them this weekend, suggesting that the person can handle the climb.

Conversation: How many people are there in your family ? There are 15 people in my family . What did you say ? How many ? 15 people . Wow . That is a very big family . Do you all live together ? Of course we do ! My father's parents , Mum , Dad , three unmarried aunts , two uncles , my two brothers , my three sisters and me . But you don't live at home anymore . My family lives in rural Korea , near Pusan . We have a huge house.The first floor of the house is a part-time private school.In the afternoon , students come for special tutoring in biology , Englis Wow ! you grew up in a school ! No wonder your English is excellent ! My aunts and uncles are all teachers . You are so lucky ! I guess so . While growing up , I read hundreds of interesting English storybooks every year . That's what i did in America . I was reading all the time . I was never a big TV watcher . TV wastes time . I agree . Summaries: The conversation starts with the speaker mentioning their large family of 15 people, all living together. They share that their family lives in rural Korea and has a huge house with a part-time private school on the first floor. Growing up, the speaker read hundreds of English storybooks every year, which helped them develop excellent English skills. This reading habit is encouraged by their aunts and uncles, who studied in American universities and agree that extensive reading for fun is the most effective way to improve one's English.

Conversation: ... Now that we have been over the gory details of our disastrous first quarter , Ed ! Give us some good news . How are things looking for us in terms sales this month ? Uh well ... would you like the bad news first or the really bad news ? What ? Ed , don ’ t tell me you only have bad news ! Well sir , our sales have dropped , no plunged , fifty percent in the past month alone . We are currently overstocked and overstaffed and our profits refalling fast . The market is in recession and we have no way of moving our inventory , or getting rid of our staff . If we consider redundancies , it would cost us a fortune because of the new regulations governing compensation packages . It ’ s a real mess . For crying out loud ... How fast are we losing money ? Um ... how can I put this ? Let ’ s just say that at this pace , we will be filing for Chapter eleven in less than three months . What ! Geez ! How could this have happened ? So what ’ s the bad news ? Oh , that ’ s the really bad news . Our supplier suffered QC problems and , well , half of our production is faulty . We ’ re going to have to recall all itemssold in the last quarter . And the worst part ? We ’ re going to have to shoulder this cost . Are you joking ? Get the supplier on the line now ! They have to assume the costs of this mess ! We tried that , sir . The factory has gone under and the owner apparently has fled the country . We ’ re doomed ! There is some really good news though ! Really ? What ! I got offered a new job !
Summaries: The company had a disastrous first quarter, with sales dropping 50% in just one month. The CEO, Ed, shares the bad news that they are overstocked and overstaffed, with profits plummeting. He reveals that the market is in recession and there's no way to move inventory or cut staff without incurring significant costs. To make matters worse, half of their production is faulty due to a supplier's quality control issues, requiring a costly product recall. The CEO adds that the supplier has gone under, leaving them with no one to assume the costs. Amidst all this chaos, an employee shares some "good news" - they got offered a new job!

Conversation: So Vicky , how long have you held your present position ? I ’ Ve been a secretary for two years , before that I was at university . And how do you like working for IBM ? Her strength lies in getting along well with people and working effectively with others, which is valuable in a team environment.

Conversation: Professor , where's Canada ? Canada is north of here . Can you show me on the map ? Sure . Look here . Canada is north of the United States . Oh , I see . Where's Mexico ? The professor also identifies Los Angeles as being in California, southeast of San Francisco; Boston is in the northeast part of the country; and Las Vegas is in the southwest.

Conversation: What kind of books do you like ? I like reading novels about early America . Really ? Me too . Which one do you like best ? Conversation: Why do you look so gloomy ? What are you looking for ? My dissertation . I put it somewhere last night and I can't find it now . Did you finish typing it yesterday ? Conversation: I'm afraid of the darkness . Don't worry . I'll drive you back . Thank you .

Conversation: What's your number ? I'm number seven . What about you ? Five . Hah hah ! You have to go before me . You think it's funny . I'm terrified . Don't worry . It's safe . Conversation: Guess what came in the mail today ? What ? My acceptance letter to Yale ! Wow ! Congratulation ! When do classes start ? Summaries: The speaker has received an acceptance letter to Yale University and is excited. They plan to attend freshman orientation in late August but want to arrive two weeks earlier to settle in. They also need to register for classes and may change their major after arriving at Yale. The conversation touches on the differences between American and Chinese/British education systems, with Yale requiring students to take fundamental courses in history, math, English, philosophy, science, and art to graduate.

Conversation: Guess what ! I know something you don't know ! What's that ? How many planets are there in the solar system ? That's easy . Everyone knows that there are nine . Not anymore !
